Reviews.Title: “Nice Touches but Needs AC”
Reviews.Author: RoseD D
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay in a nice room at the Hilton Baltimore. It's close to many restaurants and not too far of a walk from the pier/wharf area. Front desk staff were very friendly. Disappointments: Lobby bar too expensive. Could not get a late checkout (only needed 1 hour). But most disappointing was the air conditioning. This was even after engineering checked it. So sleeping was not an option in a warm room. That may be preferred by others, but not me. By the way, even the engineering staff were friendly. They leave you a chocolate hammer for contacting them!! So, customer attention A+....air conditioning--C-

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the game”
Reviews.Author: TheNad
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night before the Twins played the Orioles. You couldn't ask for a better pre-game experience. The pool, gym, and patio overlook the park and all were very well kept. All the bars are close and you actually feel safe (rarity in Baltimore).

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: We have come to expect better of Hilton Hotels. We had a backed up sink in our room, and after the third day of requesting that it be fixed, we gave up asking and just lived with it. :( MMiller1000, we also were on the 14th floor with a non-functional ice machine and had no response from staff to our requests to fix it. There was a cheerleader competition at the convention center and many of the cheerleader groups stayed in the Hilton. Hotel security did little or nothing about maintaining control over the loud and noisy groups. I am talking about people RUNNING up and down the hallways and shouting back and forth from room to room at 3AM. We did enjoy the view of Camden Yards from our room. The staff, other than the young woman at the front desk when we checked in late Thursday/early Friday, gave the impression that we were disturbing them whenever we had a question. We had a very early flight on Monday morning and requested a wake-up call for 3AM. That call came in at 3:45. We would have set the alarm clock provided by the hotel, but it did not work. I suppose it could have worked if someone had responded to our requests to get it operating. On the other hand, Tommy, one of the bellmen, went above and beyond to help us make our travel connections. Light bulbs were burned out in the bathroom and in some lamps, but again, nothing was done to replace them. The breakfast in the Executive Lounge was way below the quality we have come to expect from other Hiltons. There was nothing except milk with protein in it, very bad for diabetics. I guess the erratic functioning of our room key to operate the elevator and get us to the Executive Lounge was a blessing in disguise, or a warning. Too bad we did not heed that "warning" and go elsewhere for breakfast. The view of Camden Yards from our room was way cool! But otherwise, we'd suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised; finally understanding the nick name Charm City”
Reviews.Author: booktek
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Baltimore left me dreading this one, but I was pleasantly surprised at the friendly staff and good service in general -especially from the valet and bell captain. My room, and the hotel in general, was spotless with a nice view of the ballpark. There was a computer glitch when I tried to order room service (I wasn't showing up as the guest in my room), but the manager finally resolved it and comp'ed my meal for the delay. Best of all, the food was actually good -well prepared and better than average ingredients ingredients. The hotel is very close to the shops and restaurants at the Inner Harbor and not too far from Little Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Let's hope it gets better...”
Reviews.Author: MMiller1000
Reviews.Content: I got to my room and there was a used wash cloth hung over the shower curtain :-(. Went to get ice down the hall and the machine is out of order on the 14th floor :-(. Room nice, great view of Camden Yards if you get the right side.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: loriny66
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed here and were upgraded to ballpark room which were very nice. We are not huge baseball fans but it was nice. The hotel was very nice I didnt feel as though they had enough security anyone could walk in or out of the many entrances. We loved being close to the harbour and walked to little italy and had an awsome dinner. The only real complaint is the thin walls we heard alarm clocks going off at 5:40 am and then doors started slamming and people were yelling in the hallways at 6:30 am I believe there was a girls vollyball team staying on our floor but that is very rude to be yelling in the halls on a Sunday morning. we never comlained and our friends were on a different floor and had no noise issues so I guess we were just unlucky. Overall it is a nice place to stay but we will try someplce else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for orioles game”
Reviews.Author: Yazen
Reviews.Content: I took my son to the Orioles game on Saturday night. The hotel is located right across the street from Camden yards and we were also lucky enough to get room 458 which is next to a large outdoor patio where my wife a younger son were able to watch the game. The hotel is new and in immaculate condition. Our room was very nice, and the hotel gave us a complimentary roll away because they didn't have in the room upon check-in. We stayed two nights and both days the rooms were well cleaned. We ordered a pizza from room service for the boys and they loved it. I would like to recommended Ms. Shirleys for breakfast or brunch. It is about a mile from the Hilton and worth the walk. If you drive, you can find parking across the street in the residential areas or pay a steep price at Pier parking. Baltimore is a great weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Opening Day!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie W
Reviews.Content: We love Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor and it was only made more special by our room overlooking the ballpark!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bob_829
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Baltimore is right across the street from the entrance to Camden Yards and just a couple of blocks to the Inner Harbor waterfront. The Hotel is new and very smartly designed. It connects - a long walk - to the convention center making it a great hotel for any meetings held there is bad weather months. The room was clean and comfortable - as I expect from Hilton properties. There was a large flat screen TV in the room and while I did not have a ballpark view I had a nice view of the city. The reason I give this hotel 4 stars and not 5 is the executive lounge. While it has a great view of the ballpark, upon entering around 8pm the night of stay the lounge smelled like a locker room. It was warm and humid and did not have a pleasant smell. There was no one there to great us or anyone that asked if they could help us. It's not what I have come to expect of Hilton and it might have been a one-off night. Breakfast the next day was better and had the usual fare for the lounge. I would stay here again with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Oriole's Opening Day”
Reviews.Author: Teresa S
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great! Hotel staff is excellent! Breakfast at the Diamond Tavern was delicious and Camden yards is across the street! Our stay was just perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: TravelManSouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is honestly very nice. And it has huge assets. 1) if you are going to a game, Camden Yards is right there. By right there - I mean steps away. I've never seen a hotel so close. When I called, they said 2/10 of a mile. I must have misheard. It's literally - right there. We left our room on the 5th floor and were at our seats in 6 minutes. 2) The light rail is right there - next to the hotel's 2nd building. We took the train to the airport - 31 minutes - $6.40 for 4 of us - $30 less than a cab and most importantly, fun fo the kids. The lobby and rooms are very nice - but why the "poor" rating. Well, check in is at 4P - which is late for a hotel. Well I got there at 4:50P, only to be told my room wasn't ready. I was told - they had King rooms but not the two doubles I reserved. Ummmm - check in is 4P. I paid for a room at 4P. I was sent away - my phone # taken - and told I would be called when the room was ready. At 5:32P, I got that call. So what did I do for 42 minutes? I wasn't offered a drink or meal or anything. When I got down there - I expressed my unhappiness. Eventually, I was asked - can I buy you breakfast. Yes, I pushed knowing I'd get something - but it's wrong that my room wasn't ready. Honestly, they should have comped it - because Hilton (at least Hampton) guarantees 100% satisfaction - and they know I can't be satisfied without being in my room. 2nd note - they have a drawer with the hair dryer in it. In that drawer - a pair of women's underwear (think pink was the brand:) Seriously, house keeping doesn't check to see that the hair dryer is there - they'd have seen this. When I told the front desk 20 minutes before we were leaving and I said - just so you know for when you clean tonight - but don't send someone up now - what did they do. Send someone up. My sick wife had to answer the door. So the hotel has some great points - location, location, location - and it's nice. But they are horribly run and don't listen very well. There's a Hampton next door, and Marriott and Holiday Inn across the street. I'd probably try one of them next time. There's clearly ineptitude here.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Center Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: bigdogroad
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention here. Nice full-service hotel that was struggling to keep up during a major convention. You know the drill....can't get into your room before 4 PM....store your bags....wait for them to be delivered later....crowds at every restaurant/bar, etc. But they had pleasant staff who were trying hard and that made it better. Nice views from the 19th floor and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale, parking will cost you!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: This is a great location within walking distance of a good number of restaurants and attractions, the front desk staff were friendly and told me a good route for jogging around the inner harbour... Parking was close to $28 a night, and each time you leave, it will cost you another $10, so it is worth it to park and walk to any other destination, or do your errands before you check into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Typical city hotel”
Reviews.Author: helenann2k
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hilton Baltimore with two teenage girls. The lobby is very open and inviting, but there are not enough seating groups for people to meet and relax in. Check-in was quick and efficient. The room was comfortable, nothing unique, but very good quality and cleanliness. I tried to get soda from a vending machine, and discovered they only take credit cards, not cash. So I trekked back to my room to get my cards. I then proceeded to three different floors, where each machine refused ALL of my cards. In frustration, I went to the front desk. The person at the desk listened and then asked me how many different floors I tried, and then directed me towards another machine in he lobby that took cash. At that point, a very kind security guard stepped up to the desk and asked me what soda I wanted, and what room I was in, and told me he would take care of it. Five minutes later, he was at my door with three sodas and a smile. HE knew how to treat a guest, unlike the front desk representatve.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evonne L
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general is good. It has everything, but the room is quite small. I thought it was really good according to the pictures. But when I got there, it was quite disappointed. I didn't mean it is not good, but just not as good I as I thought.Nothing else to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Never underestimate service!”
Reviews.Author: MMauer
Reviews.Content: When traveling, I am usually not on my game because I am fatigued, disoriented and unsure of myself. The attention of the service personnel from bell captain and doorman to the assistant restaurant manager was of considerable help in a city that was totally unfamiliar. If this is an example of southern hospitality, then I need to spend more time in the South. I have lived in the Midwest USA since 1979 and thought this was as good as it gets, but everyone I encountered at The Hilton Baltimore went out of their way to assure the comfort and convenience of their guests. A special thank you to Tommy and Sancar and congratulations to the Hilton, known for service, and living up to its reputation in choice and training of employees.

Reviews.Title: “Large Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DannyBoyBlue
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a very large conference hotel with a cavernous reception area. We spent a couple of nights there in March but not at a conference. It's a great hotel, breakfast in the Hilton's adjoining building was excellent and the staff are very friendly. The room had two double beds and was spacious with a very good bathroom. For a view we were overlooking Camden Yard but there was no game on, I can see these rooms being popular in season. Hotel is very clean all round and I couldn't fault anything. It is a good stretch of your legs to the Inner Harbour but that wasn't a problem and there are lots of restaurants there. A few bars nearby, not plush but a lot cheaper than the hotel's very nice cocktail bar. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: KatieCavs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Aug 2011 for a conference and I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was immaculate and amazing views throughout. This hotel was in walking distance to anything you would want to do and the staff were very sweet and helpful! The view from the gym was awesome of Camden Yards and there was even a patio attached, so wish there was a game when I was there. My room was a nice size room with a big picture window with great views of the harbor. I would def say I have no complaints. The conference area was amazing also and food and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Solid”
Reviews.Author: tomytom
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel with a decent location near the stadiums. Was there for a conference and the facilities are what you would expect from a Hilton. Was impressed that sushi was served at the conference reception which was unexpected and different. Bar/restaurant is pretty nice but the executive lounge was mediocre compared to other Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: jodirox
Reviews.Content: 5 blocks from Light Street/Harbor--perfect if you like to walk and get a feel for the city. Beautiful, modern lobby and lobby lounge area. Delicious food, reasonably priced drinks, super friendly server. Clean, spacious room. Asked for ballpark view and were given a 5th floor room with a view of the upper decks of the stadium, not the field. Not exactly what we had in mind, but didn't spend time in the room anyway. Beautiful work out room. Great view of entire ballpark while working out. Less than friendly service when we arrived and not what we expected in a Hilton but the staff the following day made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Baltimore is a very good choice for Convention Attendees”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: I spend about 100 nights a year in Hilton properties and recently attended a convention in Baltimore and stayed at the shiny new Hilton (not sure how new) for 3 nights. Hotel was spotless, with modern design and conveniences. Very nice room with a comfortable work area and bed. I didn't pay for internet b/c of my Hilton status, but why a full service hotels still nickle and dime their customers for in room internet is beyond me. The fact that they give it away form free at their more moderately priced properties just makes them look worse. The Hotel is literally behind the outfield at the Baltimore Orioles ball park so I suppose that could be a good or bad thing depending on if you like baseball and flood lights. Very cool view from the rooms on that side of the building. Hotel is right next to the convention center which was awesome b/c I could be back at my room in just a few minutes walk at the end of a long day. Inner harbor is about a 15 minute walk. Take a cab back if you are going to be out late at night. Area gets a bit sketchy after dark. Tip: Take the more scenic (and safe) stroll to Historic Federal hill (about 18 minute walk). That area is packed with restaraunts and bars and few tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed....”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonVoyager_45
Reviews.Content: I checked in March 17th around 9:45 PM...only a single receptionist at the check in was available and there were at least 8 people waiting (not a good sign, where were the others?). Upon being assigned romo 1425, we enetered and found the room unkempt with a musty smell. The iron that we attempted ti use was working sporadically at best. The worst part about this stay was the fact that there nails or sharp metallic objects protruding on the rug just before entering the bathroom. I've added pcitures so as to pinpoint there location (hopefully they will be allowed). We stpped on them by accident (they punctured the skin) and we can only hope the tetnus booster we'll recieve on Monday will resolve the issue. When we checked out, we found out that the parking at the Hilton is a different organization (in other words there is NO free parking for guests) and we had to shell out $28.00 for the overnight stay. I am totally dissatisfied with the Hilton and will NOT be staying there ever again. To any Hilton customer service representative who reads this, feel free to refund my money for such a bad stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Especially for Business”
Reviews.Author: Chicagodocjerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week with 13 colleagues/employees for a conference. No complaints about this hotel. I feel compelled to mention that the design details in the common areas of this hotel are outstanding. The bar in the lobby has great bartenders. The restaurant served good food both times I ate there. The hotel's only strange quality is the fact that it is actually two buildings; rooms in one and ballrooms and restaurant in another, connected either by a walking bridge (indoor) or the outside walking areas. This is a little inconvenient, but actually no problem in the long run. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JWassmer
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the ballpark and walking distance to the Inner Harbour and Power Plant. Rooms and beds were great! I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better than it is”
Reviews.Author: Ron T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I actually found hotel to be really nice and the rooms were also nice. I will say that the room was large and quiet. That being said, I honestly expected better from a 4-star hotel. While the sleeping quarters were clean, the bathroom was not as clean as it should have been. There were hairpins that were left on the counter from a previous occupant. This made me wonder if they even cleaned the counter. The valet attendant was less than attentive. I had to stand there for a while before I was acknowledged. Also, if you don’t want to pay the ridiculous prices for room service, your morning coffee is across the street in connecting building (you do not have to walk outside to get there, however). And, they do not have free Wifi. I was planning on working in my room and was floored when I found out that there is no free Wifi. I mean, you get free Wifi at Starbucks but at this hotel, they expect you to pay for it. I would recommend that you do not stay at this place. I am sure that there are other 4-star hotel that are more committed to addressing the needs of their customers

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Piscesbaby82
Reviews.Content: I give this place a 5 star. I'm a Marriott person & this was my first visit ever to a Hilton. Got a wonderful rate from Hotwire for $112 for a King Room with a beautiful view of the Baltimore which normal rate starts around $229 a night. From the time I walked through the door from the time I left, this was a wonderful stay. The decor is beautiful which I am a stickler for interior decorating. I arrived around 5:30pm on Saturday 3/3/12. The only down side was my greet into the hotel. Very quick which was good but it was a "hello, where's your credit card, here's your room keys and thats it" kind of quick. Not even a have a great stay but I was able to bypass that because my check out was wonderful. The morning staff was more chipper. The room beautiful, the bed I wanted to take home with me:) and the view was outstanding. My main purpose was to visit Phillips while I was here. Our reservations were at 9pm and I did not realize how close it was. We caught a quick cab that cost us $4.50 (because of the lights) but realized it was only a good 3-4 blocks away which we decided to walk back to the hotel because it was a beautiful evening. In route to Phillips we did not know there were so many attractions just a few footsteps away. Cheesecake Factory, Hard Rock Cafe, Uno's Pizza and of course the Harbor. The Hilton is in the perfect location. We didn't get a chance to visit anything within the hotel but it is close enough reach to the Inner Harbor. Location is perfect and we had no problems walking back at night. Safe area. I must say, Hilton, you definately have my vote for an outstanding stay. Thank you so much and if in the area again, I most definately will reserve my stay here. Oh yea..the marriott is right across the street:( but you have my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great property”
Reviews.Author: ConferenceMgr
Reviews.Content: I held a meeting here in January 2011 and January 2012, and will come back in 2013. Hotel has a great location for inner harbor access, as well as accessing the convention center. Rooms are clean and spacious, and the meeting facilities are top notch. Only complaint is the UPS Store on the second floor, which is in charge of all shipping, will grossly overcharge you is you ship boxes to yourself ahead of time. I think the lobby bar should be expanded, it's crowded and popular every time I am there! There is a hotel restaurant, but there's a good amount of food options within walking distance, so I've never actually eaten at the hotel's restaurant. The concierge lounge had decent food and good service. A nice place to hang out after a long day. Also, the fitness center overlooks the baseball stadium, so you can run on the treadmill with a great view! I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: JMotsinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great downtown location on W. Pratt St. at Eutaw St. for the Inner Harbor (3-4 blocks west), Convention Center (adjacent), and Camden Yard (adjacent). We got a great deal by booking with Priceline - $70.00/88.10 with taxes - for a room with 2 double beds. The best rate booking through Hilton would have been $159.00, so we felt like we'd hit the jackpot. The hotel lobby and public areas are beautiful. Check-in was quick and courteous. The room was spotlessly clean and well soundproofed from outside noise; comfortable beds, huge flat screen TV, big thick towels. The restaurant - Diamond Tavern - is located in a separate building across a wide sidewalk from the main building - accessible by a skywalk on the second floor if weather is bad. No free breakfast here: continental breakfast was $14.00 for cereals, muffins, juice and coffee. The stone cut oatmeal was very good - hot. Self-parking in the deck was $28.00 a day. The only negative thing to report (and my reason for 4 stars instead of five) was that when we got to our room after checking in, the room key would not work, and we had to go back downstairs to get them reprogrammed. When we got back upstairs, it took several tries (and a few muffled *@%! words) before the key finally worked. Then we could not get in again after dinner and had to get the keys reprogrammed again. A real nuisance! And two glasses of house wine from the hotel bar cost $22.00, so you may want to bring your own, or drink elsewhere. We had a wonderful dinner at Alewife Tavern, which is located about 3 blocks up Eutaw St. A nice short walk. We would certainly stay here again if we could get another good rate through Priceline. Otherwise, it would be too pricey for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “The front of house staff made the visit!”
Reviews.Author: GadgetMedic
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week in the Hilton Baltimore on business, and the overall experience was typical of Hilton, very good. I have to say that the ONE thing that stood out though was the front of house, door / bell / valet / desk were all outstanding! they greeted me by name, always had my car up quickly, recommended great restaurants, gave good directions and ideas for my first time visit. I would recommend this Hilton for business travel or convention center access, but not for those looking for a Baltimore "value" stay. Service - Always great, as written above. Every staff member we met was nice and went out of their way to help. Value - Well typical downtown Hilton. No value there, can't even get a free cup of coffee anywhere. PARK IN THE GARAGE - $28 per day, Valet is $40 per day and the garage is VERY easy to get in and out so you can save yourself a little money there. Cleanliness - Lobby and public areas very well maintained. Housekeeping could pay a little more attention to detail (towels, soap replacement, etc) but it was still fine. Location - VERY convenient for convention center and inner harbor. Restaurant - OUCH on the prices, but the food was very good. Avoid the $20 breakfast buffet unless you are REALLY hungry you won't get your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: We'reReady!!
Reviews.Content: The good news is that I won the hotel on priceline after indicating a Baltimore inner habor choice. Though I was somewhat disappointed that we did not get a location very close to the waterfront, the five or six blocks walk is easily done in decent weather. We were welcomed efficiently, but the desk staff person was not overly friendly and did not offer tips on what might be in the area or refer us to the concierge. The decor of the lobby is a bit cold too; even though the style is contemporary and has a great mural behind the front desk, something more is needed to give a bit of warmth. The room is on the small side for a 4 star hotel but the beds are very comfortable! Wifi service was good. Additionally we were pleased with the shower, shampoo, and lotions provided by the hotel. The room was clean with the exception of the lamp which someone neglected to dust. Also, we were missing items from the coffee making kit. A couple of things marred our stay a bit. First,there was a future teachers convention there and several of the students were loud and raucous in the hallways and swimming pool (like a frat party). Also, the bellwoman there told me she would get us a taxi to the cruise port, a mere two miles away and stopped the van of a driver she apparently knew. Not a standard taxi. The fare should just be a few bucks; within minutes I inquired about the price and was told 30.00!!! When asked to be let out, the driver brought the fare down to 20. I sincerely believe the bellwoman/doorwoman KNEW this guy and was trying to get him extra business. I did not like the one bit and feel it reflects badly upon the Hilton. The hotel does have potential and could be an even better venue if the management were to seriously consider the trends delinated in these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carol R
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed at the Hilton in Baltimore Maryland for our 19th wedding anniversary. I didn't know how I would make this anniversary special but that God i didn't have to.... The staff could not have been more gracious and accommodating. Specifically, I am indebted to Abiola, the front desk supervisor, for making our stay a home away from home. She never seemed agitated by each request both, during the planning process via telephone and once we arrived. So often, you never see the person with whom you spoke, while making the reservations but it was such a load off of my mind to know that everything we discussed would be in place because she was handling it, personally. Abiola’s hospitality, kindness, and professionalism are unparalleled. I mentioned our traveling once a year for our anniversaries, but I also travel quite a bit in and out of the country, during the year. I’ve been upgraded and given beautiful rooms before, but never have I been moved to fondly remember the warm smile and kind, attentive disposition of a staff member the next day. Again, we enjoyed a truly phenomenal stay at your wonderful hotel due in large part to the willingness of Abiola to personally guarantee our stay’s success. We would also like to thank our bell girl Naquisha. The magnificence of the splendor of your hotel’s beauty is only surpassed by the superior service of your fine staff. We will send anyone staying anywhere near the Baltimore Harbor to the Baltimore Hilton. Thank You Mr. & Mrs. Robinson

Reviews.Title: “new property, comfortable; nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: erdocmdca
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a hospitality suite overlooking the ballpark. The bedroom was an average-to-nice HIlton room; the entertainment living room was very spacious, but mediocre in appointments, furnishings, and amenities. It felt like a big room decorated by a high schooler let loose in Macy's. The colors were neutral, and both rooms were very comfortable, though. The view straight into the outfield of the ballpark was impressive from the balcony. The shower head was odd: it was on a handle that was mounted on an adjustable height sliding rod, but it only adjusted up to my shoulder, so I had to lean over to get under the water, unless I was actually holding the nozzle. Thermostat barely varied the room temperature: it was set on 54F because the room was warm and stuffy, but the temperature didn't drop at all. $13.95/day wifi (it was fast, though); $28/night for self-parking in the garage. WAY expensive for Baltimore for what you got. Could have stayed at the Four Seasons for comparable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mgc555
Reviews.Content: We went for a quick (1 night) stay in Baltimore. Great hotel, great location. We booked through Hotwire and had a fabulous stay for a great price. Room was upgraded to a ballfield facing room - so a fantastic view of Camden Yards in the off-season. Fantastic workout room and pool, both also had a view of the ballfield. Free Charm City bus goes right by to bring to the Inner Harbor and Little Italy. Overpriced parking ($28/day) and breakfast buffet ($18/person) but those were minor compared to the great deal we got on the room. So happy with our stay!! We did have very noisy people next door but the front desk solved the problem (3 times!!) and the pool heater was broken so that did impact our 2nd pool day which was dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgreen1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a weekend event...we had a suite on the 20th floor...the suite was not the largest place I've ever stayed in but it was clean, well appointed and had a great view of the city. Although the hotel was reportedly sold out for the weekend it never felt so...the elevators where fast and hotel staff helpful. Will be back...next time I will request a stadium view. : )

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JR591011
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places to stay in Baltimore. Convenient to the Convention Center, Camden Yards and the Inner Harbor. Very friendly staff and convenient parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the convention center but kind of far from everything else”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for a convention recently and was not disappointed but also not significantly iimpressed either. The hotel is relatively new, so everything is clean and in working order. However, as other people have mentioned, the lobby is very noisy and doesn't provide a good venue to get together to talk. More annoying, however, is that the walls in the rooms are not soundproof, so you can hear quite a bit of what is going on in the rooms next to you. Worse though, is that the sounds from the hall are clearly audible in the rooms. On the plus side, this hotel is very convenient to the convention center but there isn't much else in the immediate vicinity and the area immediately to the north is kind of seedy. You need to go 5 or 6 blocks to get to the Inner Harbor although the circulator bus (which is free) stops right outside the hotel and will take you to the harbor in about 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed for a 4*”
Reviews.Author: wanderingmarine
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok but the open lobby and bar when coupled with people milling around make for a loud noisy area with nowhere public to sit and relax. I would therefore question the 4* status? Room was pleasant enough but nothin special. Hotel is geared up for the convention centre user so if you want restaurants in fells point etc you are the wrong side of town. This was a Hotwire booking and we were disappointed, so next time we will go back to the marriotvwaterfront!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, clean and upscale!”
Reviews.Author: WEKG
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay this past weekend -- the hotel looked brand new, with an extremely friendly and helpful staff. While the room was slightly smaller than we would have expected for a King, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was sparkling clean with great bath products! Lamar at the hotel bar was friendly and whipped up a few signature drinks that we enjoyed. Overall great stay... and we got engaged at the hotel that night! We will definitely be back, many times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but would someone please watch the doors?”
Reviews.Author: pugmeister2011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice. It's clean, hip, and the staff is helpful. But my second stay at the Hilton Baltimore was memorable because of a few oddballs who wandered into the hotel off the street. Baltimore is a rough place, no doubt, and I feel sorry for those in need. But I was shocked to see someone shaking a change cup at the bottom of an escalator while people were heading upstairs to an industry conference. That night, an angry man in the elevator asked me and another passenger for change. I told the conference organizers about these incidents and, in fairness, the hotel management took them very seriously. They conducted a "sweep" on the hotel. I think one problem is that there are too many points of entry into the hotel, especially for a rough town such as Baltimore. The hotel can benefit from better security. It's a shame that these incidents happened during my stay, because it's otherwise a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: world taster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in this fabulous hotel for a convention - it was all we could have asked for. The rooms were generously sized and well laid out. The furnishings and decorations were new and soothing. The room location was great with a wonderful Inner Harbour view. The staff were terrific. The hotel is several blocks from the Inner Harbour but the walk was a pleasant one. It was also within walking distance of a wonderful movie theatre located near the Marriott Waterfront. We had a great time and would highly recommend it. Others have commented on the cost of dining. The hotel was happy to provide fliers for take out restaruants that delivered. It was great chilling out in the room - particularly since the desk doubles as a room service-type table. There was nothing more we could have asked for. What a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Cookie Cutter”
Reviews.Author: NatalieF101
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great service, room, bed and food. Central and great location,

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: Justin L
Reviews.Content: For new years, my wife and I booked a room at this Hilton hotel. Must say I was very disappointed. Two main issues; 1) the room keys barely worked. 2) there were no shower/bath towels in the room. Wasn't impressed

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve with a View!”
Reviews.Author: stormi-1-n-only
Reviews.Content: My husband turned 50 on New Years Eve and we went all out and rented a suite with a balcony to view the fireworks. The suite was better than we could of imagined. Full dining room, living room, two full baths, large bedroom with second TV, a wet bar and of course, the aforementioned balcony. Two comfy bathrobes, upscale toiletries, bottled water, the works! The only thing missing was a fridge and microwave-which frankly we were surprised they didn't have. We had three heating/cooling controls so our room was the perfect temperature! We had the best seat in Baltimore for the fireworks!. Not only did we see fireworks in the Inner Harbor, but our view accommodated us with views of many fireworks going off over MD. We enjoyed the fireworks with out the crowd, the cold and the worries of getting back to our hotel safely. The concierge service was quick and they were friendly. The housekeeping staff was right on top of their game. The concierge lounge has delicious appetizers and good wine/beer. The view is also perfect for viewing the game. We have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Right next to harbor!”
Reviews.Author: Keynah
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the new year 12/31/11. This hotel is right in the middle of everything! It is walking distance to just about anywhere you want to go. The harbor mall is a 4-5min. Walk. You could leave the car in the parking garage ($28). There are also nice views of the stadium. Baltimore is probably a good place to visit in the summer. Much more things to do then. And if so I would recommend staying at the Hilton. PS. Have the breakfast buffet ($18), it's good!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: RidinWaves
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at The Hilton Baltimore and enjoyed my stay. The price was great, the view was nice and the staff was very helpful. The second day I called down to get my room cleaned while I was going to be out and when I returned four hours later the room had not been cleaned. This is always disappointing but the housekeeping manager (Steve) immediately came to my room with a cleaning staff member and let me wait in the executive lounge while they cleaned the room. I thought this was an especially nice way to make up for the mistake. I liked the lounge area in the lobby and the hotel restaurant was great! The Bellmen/Valet guys were especially helpful. I did have to pay $25 for a small refrigerator which should be standard in a hotel of this rating but luckily it was not $25 per night, one price for the whole stay. I think they should re-evaluate this cost it felt like nickle and diming. Also I could never get internet service even in the lobby which should be provided in their public spaces. Other than that everything was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean but not 4 star customer service !”
Reviews.Author: jmw1111
Reviews.Content: First of all , know in advance that the walls are very thin allowing you (Unfortunately) to hear everything through the walls...both next to you and above you ! The rooms were clean and bedding comfortable. Previous reviews mentioned lack of water pressure in shower and that is accurate. The bellmen were very friendly and the most helpful of all the employees we came in contact with. We were there for New Years Eve and unfortunately some riotous kids were in room across hall having a party. We partied for the new year as well and remained understanding and patient until it continued far too long, in the hall, bad language etc... I had to call the front desk 3 times before security came up. The girl at the front desk told me I had to realize it is New Years Eve and alot of people are partying. How completely ridiculous of her and unprofessional. I too partied, but that does not allow you to impede the sleep of an entire hall. I told her I didn't mind their party if it was IN their room but they were also in hall and in and out constantly and using very profane language. THAT I do not need to understand and she needs to better understand her job. I did speak to front desk manager next morning. He listened intently and apologized but did not make any adjustments to our account,etc. He did I suppose ask me what I'd like for him to do. I told him he needs to work with his desk staff but honestly expected him to do something for me. Regardless, I won't allow one employee to take away from all those that were helpful and polite but at at four star, they all should be on top of their game ! Four blocks from Harbor which was not a bad walk.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: bissey
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Hotel was decent and very clean. Rooms very slightly worn but clean. Check in was easy, fast. Excellent location if you are attending conference or ball game (sports museum). Great for local transport (light rail from Penn Station)and the free charm circular bus stops right outside. However, if you are a tourist you would prob be better off right on the harbor as this is a good 10mins walk away. Room service was awful, waited for over 35mins and arrived lukewarm with a less than cheerful waiter. No fridge in the room. And since it's a business area there's few coffee shops/diners in the area. The hotel could really do with a Starbucks or small coffee shop in the lobby. On the plus side there's a good gym and a decent indoor pool if you want a swift swim. Decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fantastic location, parking was a problem”
Reviews.Author: AeroHokie92
Reviews.Content: This was a reward stay and get-away weekend for my wife and I. We had a great room facing the Inner Harbor with a really nice view on the 12th floor. The hotel was quiet and we got an excellent night's sleep. I wish the room would have had a small refrigerator in it so that we could have kept our wine and cheese in it. The restaurant was closed for refurbishment, but they gave us free appetizers and sodas at night at the Lobby Lounge and free breakfast the next morning also at the Lobby Lounge. By the way, the lobby was first class and nice and open. The food was good with a taste of Baltimore (lots of items with crab and Old Bay.) We walked to the Hippodrome Theater to see a show. The staff was nice, but not really personable. We had a real problem with the parking situation. It was $28 a night, but you don't pay the Hilton, it is a separate company running the garage and valet (even though the receipt says Hilton Baltimore.) We were told to pay "by the valet", but as it turns out, you have to pay at the valet window and get a special card to get in/out privileges. We paid at a self-pay kiosk and when we left, the gate took our parking card. So when we returned, we ended up with a new card and they tried to make us pay again. I had to wait until the morning to get it resolved, and they finally let us go (since I clearly had a receipt showing I had paid my $28 just last night. But, the Hilton was not helpful in resolving the issue and was not clear about exactly where to go to pay for the night and get the special card with in/out privileges. This hassle turned the stay from an excellent to just average. I would stay again as I now know how to handle the parking, but it is still pretty expensive to park there. There also was no note of my Hilton Diamond status at any time during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Best Hotel near Inner Harbor. Great Service, Beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMan53
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great service, beautiful views, and nice rooms. The water pressure in the showers is extremely lacking at all hours, but otherwise I love this hotel. The walk to the Harbor is a little long if the weather is too cold or hot, but otherwise this hotel is the best in the area besides the Waterfront Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great hotel, Don't drive there”
Reviews.Author: Ted H
Reviews.Content: The location and hotel were amazing. There are a number of bars right by the statiums and the main inner harbor area is very close. Our room was in great condition and overlooked the baseball field which was cool even thought it was winter. The valet was terrible. We parked out front temporarily while we checked in and they lost our keys making us late for our event. Upon checkout valet was quite slow getting the car, but atleast they had the keys.

Reviews.Title: “good location for conference center”
Reviews.Author: ndalum
Reviews.Content: The Hilton in Baltimore was a good choice for a business meeting, although its conference center is separate from the hotel, via a walkway over a street. Room was quiet and updated. Nice amenities, such as a Speakman shower head in the shower. Some nits, very thin toilet paper, key card not exactly robust (several meeting attendees reported problems with the key cards) and parking is not cheap, even parking your own cost $28/day. The hotel's eatery is in the conference center, which is odd since they could convert some of the large lobby into a snack/coffee area

Reviews.Title: “Expected better from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: texanroadtripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business in late October. Before I arrived, I called to ask what transportation options were from BWI. My call was transferred and dropped several times by the hotel before I spoke to a representative, who seemed incredulous that I did not possess deep knowledge of Baltimore's transportation options. Short story: I told her I was arriving at BWI after 9pm on a Sunday, and she said I should take the light rail. Which stops running at 9pm on Sunday. Terrible sign, and things got worse from there! The front desk staff was rude. There was a pair of underwear in my room when I arrived, and the staff seemed to think this wasn't a problem of any kind ("Did you want us to send someone up to retrieve the underwear?"). I spent $1000 to stay here for several nights and found the whole stay deeply impersonal and, really, unkind. The room was average. One major pro: the fitness room has an unbelievable view into Camden Yards.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel53NewJersey
Reviews.Content: I was just at this Hilton for several days at a business seminar. I have stayed in Hiltons all over the world and found this one to be just fine. Does it have the flair of the Hilton in Prague? No. Does it measure up as a good business hotel? Yes. I had a "harbor view" room on the 12th floor. If you are expecting a true harbor view you will be disappointed. There are several building in the way and the hotel is not that close to the harbor. That said, I could definitely see the harbor and boats. Friends had rooms on the Camden Yard side and said they could look right into the baseball field. The room was clean and had a good amount of space. The king size bed was fine but have to say I was disappointed. Have gotten use to the pillow toppers and this was just a regular bed. Bathroom was large and very clean. The staff was great and very helpful. Overall this was a hotel that I would stay at again but a little coffee shop off the lobby would be a big help. There is only 1 restaurant at the hotel and it is not the type of place to grab a coffee. Starbucks is 3 blocks away. A quick walk.

Reviews.Title: “It is just ok...”
Reviews.Author: DivineExplorers
Reviews.Content: There is really nothing to rave about this hotel. My husband and I stayed at this hotel last weekend so we can let our clients know about it. We had preferred to stay at the Marriott across the street. The customer service is much nicer and better trained there. When we went to check in and I asked the front desk rep about parking she said, do not worry about it the parking is included in your rate. I asked her if she was sure and she said yes. I thought since the agent I booked the reservation on the phone with knew that we were travel agents, maybe he gave us the deal so I did not question it. The front desk rep told me to go over to valet parking and they would give us a pass to get in and out since they are separate from the hotel. We went to the valet and we told the person at the desk that we have parking included in the hotel. He said that he would need to see some sort of statement stating it before he could give us the pass. He said that twice and then he said, never mind, I will just call the front desk and ask them. He called the front desk and the same front desk rep verified that we had parking included in the rate so we were able to get the parking pass. It had been a long day for my husband and I so we decided to turn in earlier because we had a busy day on Saturday. About an hour after we had retired to our room (approx 9:30am) I received a call from front desk rep who checked us in stating that we did not have parking on our room and that I must come down and pay for the parking. I could not believe they called the room that late. I did not go down to the valet until the morning. Of course when I got there in the morning, there were different people there. So we explained to them what had happened and went ahead and paid for the parking. All of this could have been avoided if the front desk rep was better trained! The best part about the stay was the buffet breakfast at the Tavern. You can get freshly made omelets and Belgium waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we bid on Priceline for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: madreRochester
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight last night in this Hilton hotel. It was so average that we were surprised. The room was okay but the mattress was smaller than the base of the bed - leaving an awkward 4-6 inch overhang to bump into. The room was okay but not unusually comfortable even as hotel rooms go. We had a drink at the lobby bar and expected the $9-10 per drink charge. We did not expect the drinks to be so watered down, however. I am really not a drinker and even I had to say that I would be surprised if any alcohol was in my tonic water. Our biggest gripe was that in the morning, we hoped to grab a cup of coffee and something quick to eat but there is nothing available in the hotel. We were directed across the street to the convention center to a very busy and uncomfortable restaurant. Deciding not to wait, we walked to the Marriott and grabbed a cup of coffee and muffin in their lobby. All in all, we were glad that we bid on the room and did not pay the asking price for it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RLA443
Reviews.Content: The main asset for this Hilton is that is located next to the convention center and across a driveway from Camden yard ball field. With the right room choice you are all most in the outfield!!. Along with the great view of the ballfield I could see an indoor pool, but it was not mentioned in the hotel directory and It was the second night before I figured out it was on the 4th floor. The room was Ok, the TV was nice but the carpet was dirty and has spots. The lobby seemed deserted most of the time even though there were several meetings going on in the hotel and conference rooms. The inner harbor is a long three block walk. There is a free circuit bus that goes from the hotel to the inner harbor but DO NOT USE IT TO GET BACK. It goes through several city blocks and is used by transients and others that will leave you worried about your safety. The restaurant is OK It is a sports bar and reminds you of the Vegas buffet dining areas. The staff was helpful and friendly. If you have a car be sure and self park, The deck ($28) is under the hotel and easy to get to once you figure it out. Valet parking is more expensive and not more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Patito217
Reviews.Content: Trip in mid July was 3rd or 4th time staying in this facility. I got a super deal on the rate which was even better. I stay at this hotel b/c it is adjacent to the convention center which is accessible by completely indoor walkways. The meeting I attend is usually in Nov/Dec so an indoor walk way to convention center means my coat, boots etc stay in hotel room and I am not keeping track of those items while going back and forth between meeting rooms and exhibit hall. A huge plus in my opinion. The front desk staff is courteous, helpful and the wait staff in both the bar and restaurant are friendly as well as helpful and the food is not bad either. Across street is Camden Yards (and being a Marylander) the most beautiful park in MLB. The hotel is located at the edge of Inner Harbor area, however if that is your primary destination there are other nice hotels cheaper and closer to the actual Inner Harbor. But if you are attending a conf. at the CC can not do better. (I probably should not say that b/c next year when I want to make reservation for my conf. the rooms will be booked.) The rooms are standard Hilton rooms, large enough to meet most requirements. Parking is extra and is underground and accessible without going outside. It is not that I am allergic to fresh air or anything but having had the ????pleasure????? in the past of walking thru ice and snow with a cold wind blowing off the harbor to get to my meetings there is a lot to be said for indoor corridors and parking garages accessible by elevator directly into hotel. One of the other well known chain hotels at the other side of CC has an out door walkway to the CC and a garage that requires you to drag your suitcase outside, although the walkway from garage is partially covered but in driving rain you are still wet. So for wimps like me it is the well protected Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Lacked some essentials”
Reviews.Author: Peterjules
Reviews.Content: Checked in late evening after overseas flight. Put bags in room and went to have dinner and a couple of drinks. Next morning, looked for bottled water and discovered no mini bar at all or any bottled water in the room. This is normally found in any other hotel I have stayed in around the world. Getting dressed at 6am in the morning to get a bottle of water from the lobby shop is not an option to me This is a convention hotel linked to the convention centre and these fundamentals I would have expected in any Hilton establishment. Hotel is close to the harbour but be warned, do not stray more than three or four blocks or you may find yourself in areas you do not want to be in. Lobby Bar is understaffed meaning that you can wait far longer for service than acceptable. Location is great for sports fans and convention visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great jumping off point!”
Reviews.Author: Jerelissa
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Baltimore Hilton for a bachelor party. Although we didn't spend much time at the hotel, it was very nice. The staff was friendly and professional. The room was very clean with a nice sized tv, but the view was the most memorable point of the room. We had an amazing view of Camden Yards. It's about a 20 min walk the inner harbor area, shopping malls, and so much more. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “never ever ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: Zwein
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my mother last june, in our reservation we had requested connecting rooms which was confirmed to us, however upon check in (which took an hour to complete) apparently no one knew of our request. we reserved two rooms at $459 a night!!! front desk staff are careless, rude, and have a very bad attitude! trying to check in took an hour, and checking out too! there's only 1 or 2 ppl at the desk at any given time. our rooms that were thankfully on the same floor at least had paper thin walls, i am typically a heavy sleeper, i could not sleep, the rooms overlooked the baseball stadium, (FYI they dont always turn off the stadium lights at night) and the curtains/blinds were not equipped to block out that much light! next morning, we ordered coffee and bagels with cream cheese to our rooms, it took about 1 hr and 35 mn to get our food. conclusion: instead of staying 2 weeks, we stayed 2 nights.. really awful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: GregRich
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a wedding during football season and still had a great time. The hotel is centrally located to the harbor and aquarium making it an easy walk. The staff was pleasant and the rooms were immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hilton”
Reviews.Author: noreenT
Reviews.Content: We had to beg for caffeinated coffee in our room. Very stingy on soap and towels also. Had to keep calling for what should be basic accommodation in a 4-5 star hotel like a Hilton. Room service expensive for the quality of the food.Wouldn't recommend it. Go over to their restaurant instead. The food and service there (Diamond) was outstanding. Look for another hotel. Unless you are attending a conference (as we were) at the Convention Center. Housekeeping must be not adequately staffed as they kept asking me if I wanted "service" when I would be in my room during a break time in the AM. That shouldn't even be a question.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: apl175
Reviews.Content: This modern Hilton is one of the best and nicest in the brand family. Over the last two years, I've stayed at Hiltons from Vienna to Houston, and this is one of the few notably decent ones. I've stayed at this one, for 3 nights, spread over two visits in the month of October 2011. The GOOD: - If you can get an upper floor suite for a reasonable price (post reservation upgrade offer) DO IT. The views, particularly towards the ball park (even off season) are WONDERFUL. - Rooms are comfortable, well appointed, beds are fairly comfortable and things are setup for a decent night of rest. - The Exec lounge is open until 10pm (if I remember) for drinks - even on the weekends - There are ACTUAL HD CHANNELS on the flatscreen TV(s) - and in some suites a media breakout box to connect a laptop. - This is one Hilton where the room service menu and delivery are EXCELLENT. Delivery is in 35 minutes or less - the pasta, the wings, and everything with the word "Crab" in it are highly recommended. - The doorman was able to direct me to a restaurant on Pratt Street where I was meeting clients - and even encouraged me to walk rather than spend money on a cab since it was relatively nearby. The BAD: - Even SELF-Parking is expensive - Some suites include a Yamaha "Soundbar" below the bedroom TV. This surround speaker system was not configured properly in the room I was in. - SLOW Internet - the "Free" version for Gold/Diamond guests is < 1 Mbps down, and 0.5 Mbps. You can also get a higher 2Mbps service for $12.95 additional per night. All are still substantially below the FCC definition of basic broadband (4Mbps Down)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mlsimp2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and enjoyed the entire experience. I had a conference headquartered at this hotel with meetings and meals here as well. Check-in was smooth and Linda was very helpful offering advice about transportation into Washington, D. C. and around Baltimore. We enjoyed the room and view of Camden Yards despite the charge for internet. The train to DC which is just about a block away is convenient and the Charm City Circulator is great to get around Baltimore. The Bellmen can get you a cab with a whistle. I only have two complaints...the first involves the lobby bar. it has a great atmosphere and staff but with multiple conventions at the hotel and two nights in a row they had no Crown Royal. The second was an ongoing issue with housekeeping for additional bath towels. Each day we had to ask for more towels than two....My wife and the staff seemed to be at odds to accept our needs. Overall a great property though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms without harbor view”
Reviews.Author: csserious
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton for a convention and found the hotel to be quite good. Although there was long line of cars for the convention in front of the hotel causing delay, the lady at check-in made us feel comfortable at last. The walkway connecting to Baltimore convention center was very convenient in the middle of night. It is worth noting that there are other hotels with shorter walk but they do not have a walkway. The inner harbor is five to ten minutes walk although our room had no harbor view. We found that the breakfast room was kind of small for a Hilton and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice”
Reviews.Author: hotel2006av
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Baltimore for 5 days & 4 nights for a conference in October. I spent a lot of time researching hotels and this seemed like the best fit for me. The most important aspect was how close I would be to the conference center as I was spending most of my time there. It was very nice to be able to get back to my room in between sessions and programs. The conference center is actually connected to the hotel. The hotel is very large, new, and well appointed. The service is mostly good. I did not have much time to dine out so I ordered a lot of room service. At first there were some issues with the temperature of the food etc etc but those issues did get corrected. Vegetarians will need to be a little creative. There is no veggie burger! I was shocked when I dined in at the Diamond Tavern and was told there was no veggie burger or veggie specific entree! I felt there were a lot more veggie breakfast options. Also want to note that they do allow dogs and was happy to bring mine! One downside they charge $11/day for internet access. They are very accommodating and was a pleasant stay and will stay in that spot if I return to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice while its new, good views”
Reviews.Author: lovewell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a quick weekend stay. Normally I don't stay in Hilton's for non-business but I chose the location for convenience to the Baltimore marathon. The hotel itself is nice because its new. I like that it had plenty of elevators whose doors closed quickly...thats normally a pet peeve of mine in Hiltons. Pros: Very new, clean comfortable rooms, fast stable internet Walkway to convention center, close to everything downtown, easy to get a cab Great view into Camden Yards if you are on that side of the hotel Cons: Check-in isn't great, the HHonors line wasn't really being followed and I had several people cut in front of me, would've been quicker to just stand in general line. The Diamond Tavern is a building over, and they boast being a classy sports bar, but their 20 tvs don't have any sports packages and very limited local stations so they had virtually no games on. Definitely not worth it given all the true sports bars a street over. If my company wants to put me up here again thats fine, but given the similar proximity of the Hampton Inn I wouldn't spend the extra dime out of pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: debbie46160
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, but very cold the lobby was so cold and the rooms freezing we were able to adjust our temperature but the people we were with could not adjuste theirs. The rooms were okay but some what older looking the bed skirts were dirty, The staff was helpful when we asked questions as to where to go to eat and see. We went down for a red sox game and the hotel is located at the enterance to the Baltimore baseball stadium. It was about a 10 min walk to the inner harbor which was very nice. Good work out facilities and very nice pool and hot tub area. We went to the Pratt Street Ale house to see the patriots game and they were so good they put us in a room with other fans and let us stay for the whole game the food was good and the prices reasonalbe.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Jamilah C
Reviews.Content: This hotel does NOT live up to its reputation. During check in I asked if my room had a view of the harbor. The staff person informed me that they are actually not close enough to see the Inner Harbor and that the hotel is thinking of changing that info on the website because it is misleading. I asked how far away we were from the harbor, she said 7 blocks. The first room I checked into had a rancid sour smell. I left the room and came back in about an hour, thinking the smell would go away. It was still there when I returned. I called the front desk and they gladly changed my room. The next room they put me in had no smell, but when I sat on the bed I noticed that there was hair all over the pillows. I called the front desk again. They sent a housekeeper up to change the pillow cases. After a few hours I needed to get dressed to go to an event. I tried to iron my clothes, the iron didn't work. I called a manager and they sent the head of housekeeping up with a new iron. He tried the old one out himself and was apologetic because he agreed that it was broken. When I got back in that night, the manager had written me an apology note with two comp tickets for breakfast. I ended up staying another night at the hotel. The check in staff offered me a view of the ball field. I said sure. When I got to the room there was no ball field out the window. I would not stay here again. They are not a 4 star hotel in my opinion. They 2nd night I spent $209 for a small room. There has to be better deals for the money in downtown Baltimore. At the very least a hotel should be clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MoeKell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently while in Baltimore to attend a baseball game. Stayed on the 18th floor. The view of Camden Yards from our room was good, but the view from the lounge on this floor was fantastic. You could have listened to the TV and watched the game right from there. The bed was the most comfortable one that I have ever slept in and the pillows were fantastic. Because we were on one of the luxury floors, I beleve there was a complimentary continental breakfast in the loung, but we never took advantage of it. Definitly a little on the more expensive side, but that was due to the location. Plus I would rather pay a little more to stay in a great hotel next to the park then to go cheap and stay some fleabag motel and have to contend with traffic/crowds when the game is over. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SheriBobLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: I guess it was because I was there on business, I found Anna at the front desk to be rude at best. The rest of the staff was sometimes accomadating, but on two occasions Anna was rude and acted like I was a bother. Not one of Hilton's best stays. Two weeks ago I stayed at the Marriott a crossed the habor. I will make the trip to the Marriot next time. The soda machines on the floor only took credit cards when I went to the desk because there is a cash soda machine in the lobby area I was pointed by the front desk to where the machine was it was a maintance man who took me to the machine which only took quarters, 10 of them, when I asked the desk for change the first person said no, so I went to the other end of the desk they were happy to give me change. One out of every three encounters with any of the staff I was made to feel like a bother. Well I won't bother them again. I'll be on the otherside of the habor with more attentive staff and better resturants in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in the middle of Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Kathrine
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for a long weekend. Wow ~ what a nice hotel! The hotel and the room were very clean, the staff was friendly, the beds very comfortable, the room quiet (no noisy heat/ac unit). Our room was facing ballpark so the view was extremely nice from the 15th floor. The bank of 6 elevators were quiet and efficient. Didn't eat here so can't comment on the food. The location is close to everything offered at the inner harbor. The Charm City Circulator (orange route) is right outside the front door which will take you around part of the city for free. You are able to connect with other Circulator routes. The only down side was the fee for parking - even self-park was expensive. Other than that, great place to stay and I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel and 5 star price”
Reviews.Author: surfgermany
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel very new great lobby area and bar very good for Camden m and t field convention center or the 1st mariner areana. Room was good 4th floor was noisey from the traffic till 12-1 am. So very good buiness class hotel in Baltimore. Now its the weekend no and only balitmore is empty parking for guest 28 bucks parking for non guest 28 bucks? really 120 for a double and not even a discount on over night parking. Food had to get up early for our event at 1st Mariner so thought we would hit the resturant for breakfast or do room service .. al l i have to say is oatmeal 9 bucks add fruit 13 bucks. coffee 4 bucks pancakes 13 bucks add fruit 16 bucks. Really ? wonder why everone was going out at 7 to find something else I dont. This may work on weekdays with the bussiness traveler on a expense accout but weekend foot/base/basketball or convention goers wont pay that level. TV almost no channels news and cartoons that was it one local ch. but tons of pay per view. and now the final grab internet 24 buck a day for wired or wireless duh walk accross the street and get free and caltor. Just stayed in the DR for 2 weeks internet was 8 a day or you could buy 1 hr for 5 bucks and use it all week to check email so 24 in balitmore is a scam. I have reservations at 2 hotels next weekend and both of these 70 buck a night hotels offer free wifi and wired. One glass in the room 3 towel 1 glass? Check around the inner harbor I know next time I have to go for something on the weekend i will try the other hotel options and I am a long time hilton fan bangkok hongkong jakarta perth wdc etc etc etc I have used hilton as the standard for 20 yrs and have never felt like they were ripping me off till Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but Something's Missing”
Reviews.Author: sircampalot1
Reviews.Content: Went there for a conference. So here's the good: It's lovely. Looks and feels modern and new. Tasteful interiors and rooms. Clearly much thought was put into creating a contemporary unity that was spare, but not bland. Compliments to the designer. Rooms have standard hotel conveniences. Conference facilities were good too. Large spaces that can be made smaller. A merciful absence of fake wood and giant chandeliers. Bell staff was super helpful and one even arranged a special trip for me by keeping his ears open to where the taxi drivers and chauffeurs were heading. Thanks dudes! If baseball's your thing, the lounge on the 18th floor overlooks the field and serves very weak free coffee. There's a nice pool and decent, but not special, gym facilities. Now the negatives. The food served at the conference was really bland (actually, I wasn't crazy about the food in Baltimore in general). The VERY young wait staff did their best, but seemed undertrained. They were dropping stuff everywhere and didn't seem to know how to speak to guests. Reception staff did nothing wrong, but neither did they seem engaged. The coffee in the rooms was weak, although I liked the simple machine. There's no where to get good coffee in the building (The Marriott across the street serves Starbucks and there's a full SBs 3 blocks away). Maid service was responsive and English speaking. Free wifi in the public spaces cuts you off after a half hour. Totally annoying. Overall this a good hotel that's worth the money, but is nothing special. A grade of three seems low but 4 also seems high. 3.5!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tripgrammy
Reviews.Content: Great location adjacent to Camden Yards with a view of the field. Close to the Convention Center, 1st Mariner Arena & Inner Harbor. Absolutely clean. Although we were only in town for a conference 1 night, we did try 2 of the restaurants within the Hilton. Recommend the Jimmy Johns for gourmet sandwiches & friendly service with patio dining available & reasonable prices. We also had lunch in the Diamond Tavern. Salmon salad was outstanding. Staff was friendly & helpful from the front desk to bell staff & valet. We stored baggage after checking out until our meetings were completed. Wifi is accessible but there is an additional charge, unlike most hotels that provide this free.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Years!”
Reviews.Author: Sunblader
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here and this hotel was top notch! The kind front desk agent ensured we had a great view on the top floor which was very kind of him. The host of the 18th floor lounge was always a wonderful smiling face every morning for breakfast. The facilities were clean and the gym has one of the best views of a stadium you'll ever get! Great location. Great staff. VERY clean and modern and we'd stay here anytime again. Book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeffngetty
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently stay there on our anniversary, We arrived way early and knew our room would not be ready. I checked in and told the front desk staff it was our anniversary and the moved us to the Executive level rooms and we had the best view of the ballpark on the 19th floor. It was a really great hotel, great rooms, great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room & wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Permanentvacay
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our room. It was clean, nice sized, and had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service,”
Reviews.Author: Arnold C
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms for four days. One of my associates had to come in a day late. She called and confirmed that she’d be in a day late but would still take four days. When she showed up, Hilton had given her room away. She complained stating that she had confirmation for her four days. The front desk person said it was Hilton’s word against hers so she wouldn’t be getting a room. I then came back to a room that had not been cleaned. We left for dinner at 7:00 with the front desk saying it would be cleaned while we were out. We return at 11:00 to a dirty room. We call the front desk again. They say housekeeping will be up within 30 minutes. An hour later, no housekeeping. This is a very poorly managed hotel. Choose another place if you want basic services.

Reviews.Title: “5th Anniversary Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Linny D
Reviews.Content: We go to the Hilton Baltimore every year for our Anniversary but they made it extra special for us this year - our 5th Anniversary!!! My husband absolutely LOVES this hotel - especially the view of the ballfield from their beautiful exercise room!! When we arrived - we were surprised that we had been upgraded for our anniversary to a top floor suite w/all the extras - Champagne and cheese/cracker tray delivery, jacuzzi tub, and executive floor rights! The Hilton Baltimore will be our forever anniversary get-away (except our 10th year - when we go to Bora Bora)!!! Thanks Hilton Baltimore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Business meeting limited wireless”
Reviews.Author: Ssh_mom
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great. Customer service better than average. But after paying premium for wireless access, the network wasn't available in on-premise meeting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay to Catch A Football or Baseball Game”
Reviews.Author: Canes99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel to catch a football and baseball game, can't get any better than this place. You can walk to both activities and it is only a 10 minute walk to Harbor. Front Desk was very helpful and very professional. The hotel is new and attracts many conferences/business people, which is ironic as it charges $15.00 a day to use the internet at the hotel. Also, no free business center so you have to use the UPS store within the hotel to print anything out (boarding passes are free). The hotel is located right next to the light rail. I would stay there again, great place!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trentmick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came for a spur of the moment long weekend getaway. We were very happy with the staff, accommodations and location right next to Camden Yards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great View of Camden Yards!!”
Reviews.Author: AmericanGringo45
Reviews.Content: The morning after Hurricane Irene came through New Jersey we were supposed to go to Baltimore for two nights for a Yankee game and Toronto game. Well, after having no power, a foot of water in the basement, and a huge clean up to deal with, we decided to leave it all and just go for one night. We bought both nights on a package through Expedia, so we figured we would be out one nights stay. We drive down from New Jersey and checked in. The hotel is beautiful, and right across from Camden Yards, which means park your car and head for the ball game. We explained our desire toonly stay for one night and the reason why. We also explained to the desk we understood we would be out for the second nights stay. She called over the manager, and to our surprise, we were credited then and there for the second's night stay. Due to the storm, they were very understanding. We really appreciated it. We had a ballpark view room on the 12th floor. What a view! iIf you go down to the 4th floor and out to the pool and fitness area there is a viewing deck with a perfect view of the entire stadium. Don't even need a ticket to see a game! The room itself was clean, well laid out, and very comfortable. The beds were great, I don't think I ever slept so well in a hotel room. And despite the proximity and facing the stadium, the room was extremely quiet. We will be using this as our Base of Operations from now on when we do our yearly trip to Baltimore to see the Yankees play.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more..”
Reviews.Author: kariwBaltimoreMD
Reviews.Content: I will first start off by saying that the ballpark view was incredible! We stayed here for 2 nights to include the night we were married. We had to have our room key re-keyed several times b/c it wouldn't work in the elevator to allow us access to our room.
