The few times that we went to the concierge floor for a drink or snack the employees were playing on FaceBook or their iPad, and barely looked up to say hello when we entered (which is key-card access only so you pay additional money for this "privelege") When I called in the weeks/days prior to arriving the employees were pretty abrupt on the telephone, and had an "i don't care" attitude about the fact that I needed to check in early because of the wedding. The parking is very expensive...we paid $108 for roughly the equivalent of 3 days. The valet persons overall were not interested in their jobs or overly friendly. The hotel bar is full of cheap wine, and closes at 12. They are also not interested in being attentive or making non-alcoholic drinks for people that can not or do not drink. We had a wonderful bellhop named Brendon- so if you do stay there make sure that you ask for him! Brendon also made sure that we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us after our wedding! For our next trip to Baltimore we will definitely stay at one of the Marriott hotels, and not the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service, well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Sazelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I joined our two friends (another couple) and brought along our two French Bulldogs this past Labor Day weekend for the Baltimore Grand Prix. We chose the hotel more for its location (right inside the track) than anything else at the time, but we soon came to be very impressed with it overall. It was spotlessly clean, the service was terrific, and the perks from staying on an Executive Level floor were well worth the money (complimentary breakfast and snacks anyone?) It's also refreshing to stay in a very polished, updated hotel that allows pets!! As other dog-owners will agree, very often we're forced to stay at less-than-desirable locations just because we've brought our furry "children" with us. Not so here - they welcome dogs and don't make you feel like an inconvenience by relegating you to smelly, musty pet-only rooms. That, plus the cleanliness and service, means we will be back! On a side note, we arrived much later than expected and ordered late dining in-room service from the Diamond Tavern. We're foodies and tend not to be impressed with many hotel restaurants, however their fare was pretty darn good. We wanted to try the restaurant proper but never had the chance, though we'll definitely go there next time around. The Hilton Baltimore has become our primary hotel when we visit Baltimore from here on.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeEB
Reviews.Content: I made the reservations for this trip in May 2011, for our stay at the end of Aug. I purchased the rooms through Hilton's "advanced purchase" option which gives you a discount but the rooms are non-refundable. We also purchased tickets for a Orioles vs. Yankees game. We only had one minor problem...Hurricane Irene. We were supposed to travel to Baltimore via Amtrak on Sunday, Aug. 28. Amtrak cancelled all train service between Stamford, CT. and Baltimore from Saturday until midday Wednesday. I called the hotel several times worried about my non-refundable reservation. Eventually I found a super nice person in Hilton's "Adv. Purchase Reservations" who called the hotel and talked with the manager and then informed me they would slide the reservation until we arrived due to the hurricane. They couldn't have been nicer. When we arrived three days late the reservation was waiting for us. I was so pleased. The desk clerk was super, but he was from another hotel and had been brought in to help with the anticipated crowds for the innaugural Balimore Grand Prix that was to be run that weekend. I would agree with sereral other reviews in TA that the majority of the front desk crew was not very helpful and not the "sharpest knives in the drawer". The hotel has three types of room reservations: normal rooms, harbor view, ball park view in ascending order of pricing. The hotel is right next to Camden Yards and is ideal if one is planning on attending a baseball game. We chose the harbor view for $229 per night plus tax of $35 per night. This is a bit pricey but the room was very nice. It was large, wonderful bed with good linens and down pillows, a comfortable desk area plus a lounging chair, a large flat panel high definition TV with lots of channels to choose from and a large clean bathroom. One oddity of this hotel is there is no eating facility in the main lobby area or main building. Their dining room or eating facility is in an attached "meeting room" facility and is called the Diamond Club. We went there for dinner the first night and the pricing on the menu was "over the top". We finally chose hamburgers from their lunch menu ($12) and they were miserably prepared (I will spare you the story). I complained to the manager and he apologized and gave us a comp. breakfast buffet the next morning ($16 per person). The buffet was good but not great. Other reviewers have said go elsewhere and I would agree. Excluding the dining, i would say the hotel was very nice and we will stay there next year when we go back to see our baseball game. (The Orioles said we could send them our tickets and we would get credit for them for any game next year...sounds good to me.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for baseball games!”
Reviews.Author: NickyNewark
Reviews.Content: We go to Baltimore every year for Yankee/Oriole games. This is our third time staying at the Hilton. The first time we stayed there was the day it opened, which was pretty cool. I'll start with what I love about the hotel. First, it is 1/2 block from Camden Yards and the street you have to cross is closed to traffic. You're practically staying in the stadium! Second, on the 4th floor, there is a large terrace open to all guests. It's right next to the gym. There are tables and chairs on this terrace and it overlooks the stadium. You can watch the game, with a beer, without going to the stadium. Third, the gym is very clean and very large for a hotel. The gym overlooks the stadium too. Fourth, the pool has a lifeguard and it's great if you're traveling with kids. Always bring a bathing suit. My only complaints is the staff. They're nice, but ineffective and slow. Plus, for a 3 year old hotel, the rooms shouldn't look as run-down as they are. Plus, housekeeping can step it up a bit. Oh, there is one more good thing, they allow pets!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: singer284
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great..the rooms clean and modern and the staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: mmfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family. Great location to Camden Yards. Beautiful hotel, excellent fitness center. Well appointed rooms and friendly staff. Easy walk to harbor and so perfect for attending a baseball game at Camden Yards. Excellent stay with a nice restaurant. Only complaint was someone was smoking on our floor. PLEASE do a better job to make sure the hotel is really "smoke-free".

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mdFoxes
Reviews.Content: I stayed and attended a conference here. The room was spacious enough with the better quality linens and down pillows and had an awesome view of Camden Yards. The staff was friendly and quite helpful - thanks Justin at the front desk! The meeting facilities right there in the hotel were quite nice with adequate restrooms but no coffee available so bring your own. They have a parking garage that "only" costs $28 a day. They say you need to pay for internet access in your room and the lobby, but I was able to get a promo code which allowed free access. (The meeting rooms had unsecured internet.) The hotel had a restaurant on the premises but it was very pricey - $20+ for a basic breakfast. However, there were several others to choose from within a block. I recommend Luna Del Sea for lunch. It has outside cafe seating and great soups for more reasonable prices. It is an reasonable walk to the Harbor Place which has shopping, food, and entertainment. Overall, a nice visit but I was glad that my employer was the one paying the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: uoftn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a 3 night stay at this lovely hotel. It is conveniently located to many attractions in Baltimore, with a 5 block walk to the Inner Harbor. We checked in after midnight, due to a 4 hour airline delay and the front desk (Tim) was absolutely wonderful and efficient in answering our questions after a frustrating day of travel. We were able to take an Inner Harbor Boat Cruise, trolley tour of the city, visit the Aquarium, and take in a concert at the Pier 6 Pavilion (Bill Cosby). We also greatly enjoyed a stroll around Fell's Point (got there via water taxi), Harbor East, and Little Italy (must eat at Amicci's- great place). We also enjoyed a great dinner at the Rusty Scupper (even though it had mixed reviews that we read). While the Orioles were not in town, we would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Baltimore. Very comfortable beds, spacious rooms, and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - Love the Baltimore Hilton”
Reviews.Author: JacoBites
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great - the rooms are spotless and spacious. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. I have stayed at this Hilton twice and except for some small glitches with room service, everything was wonderful. I asked twice for restaurant recommendations and both times I was directed to fantastic places. I think the staff is outstanding. For those who arrive at BWI - this Hotel is on the Light Rail Line. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and unique proximity to Orioles Park”
Reviews.Author: AJGSudbury_ON
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baltimore Hilton as it was the host hotel for a math teacher's conference that my wife was attending. This is a very new, modern hotel that overlooks the interesting Orioles Park baseball stadium complex and fronts on Pratt St. - the inner harbour's main drag. We checked in quickly, but found the first room we were given had a strong odour (sort of like sour milk). When we informed the front desk, they apologized and quickly provided us with another room down the hall on the same floor that solved the problem. The room was a generous size, with two double beds outfitted with quality linens that felt very nice. The TV was a large flat-screen that had accessible AV inputs so we could hook up the portable DVD player from our car to play movies. As other reviewers have stated, the daily parking is expensive ($28), but on-par with most downtown hotels in large North American cities. The lot was well-lit, easily accessed and had obvious security patrols. I was a bit concerned about evening parking as there was a baseball game on each of the three nights we stayed there, but this proved not to be a problem (maybe due to the surprisingly low attendance). The only recurring problem was an issue that came about because of the number of teachers attending the math confernce. During breaks and at wrap-up time, the elevators were absolutely swamped and it took forever to move between floors. Although on the main drag, the Hilton is a bit west of most of the shops/restaurants of the inner harbour. Fortunately, Baltimore has the 'charm city circulator', a fleet of very modern, clean buses that run on two (soon to be three) routes that are absolutely free. We used it all the time to hop down the road to the restaurants of the inner harbour and even the newer East Harbour area with the Whole Foods market, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location for Orioles Park and M&T Stadium”
Reviews.Author: MAN615
Reviews.Content: Got room from Hotwire for about half the price it actually goes for. Right next door to Orioles Park, perfect if your going to see a game. Modern looking mostly business hotel. Room was standard, bed was comfy, definately built for business travelers. 28 bucks a day for parking at the hotel, so keep that in mind if driving there. Had no problem checking in, quick and efficient. Would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MrWonderfulToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. 2 minutes from new ball park. A game was on and the area was hopping. Restaurant OK. Service was fine but you have to pay for parking separately which is a bit of a hastle. It's located on the revitalized Inner Harbor which is quite nice. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, friendly, rooms just a bit small.”
Reviews.Author: GWorldTour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 4 month old and had trouble with space as we had both a stroller and a portable crib to squeeze in. So, factor that in when I say room was a bit tight. We had a neat view of the Baltimore baseball stadium. I enjoyed having the free city shuttle bus stop right outside the hotel, very convenient. A nice, very big lobby made the hotel feel spacious. Lots of conferences are held here as it ajoins to the Baltimore convention Center which also was the reason for our trip. Solid 4 star, no real complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but no bargain.”
Reviews.Author: VTglobetraveler
Reviews.Content: While the location is great..beside Camden Yards (you can see into the ball park from the patio on the 4th floor) and walking distance to the harbor where there are lots of museums and attractions, it is no bargain. Parking is $28 a day! Internet is $14 a day. Even though I was there for a conference and could get the Internet in my meeting rooms, it was not available in my room. The pool is ridiculously small for such a large hotel. There is no refrigerator in the room. The tap water tastes terrible and bottled water and sodas are $2.75 at the vending machines and you MUST use a credit card! We had to wait a long time to check in, but the front desk staff was helpful when asked questions on other occasions. It is very convienent to the light rail, so it only cost us $1.60 apiece to come from the airport (takes less than 30 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, disappointing amenities”
Reviews.Author: stressfreegolfer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a conference at the Baltimore Hilton. The room was wonderful, but I was disappointed to find that free wireless internet service was available only in the lobby which was packed with others from the conference doing their work. No complimentary coffee in the lobby aside from the packaged stuff in the room. The pool and fitness centers were lovely, but no directions or times were posted in the room. The friendly desk staff answered all my questions, but this could have been avoided if the room contained a hotel directory with all the locations. Also, the ice machine on the floor was non-functional. Small inconveniences, but they were annoying nonetheless. I'd choose another hotel for future business in Baltimore. Not for the tourist!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but problems spoiled the experience...”
Reviews.Author: LiveForVacations17
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights last month for business/pleasure. He was there for a convention but we extended our stay to do some sightseeing. First the good points: nice room/hotel decor, good maid service, very convenient location, pleasant staff members. Now onto the bad... It states that check-in is at 4:00 but our room wasn't ready until 5:00, which I think is a little late for check-in. They allow pets, which may be nice for some people but the fact that we were placed in a room next to a woman with a yappy dog who barked incesantly for hours was extremely annoying. We called down to the front des who alerted security. They came up and verified that, yes, there was indeed a barking dog next door but didn't do anything about it. Also, this same dog decided to relieve itself in the hallway while we were walking to the elevator with this particular pet owner. In my opinion, I think that there should be a designated floor(s) for people who bring their pets with them to this hotel so its not an inconvenience for those of us who left ours at home. The second issue I had with this hotel was the elevators. For most of our stay, 2 of the 6 elevators were out of service and this was a major inconvenience. At times we waited 15 minutes for an elevator which is ridiculous. My last issue with this hotel is that we had booked 3 nights through my husband's company and an additional night through his Hilton Honors points as a reward night stay. At check-out they not only charged us for the reward night but also charged us for the reward night a second time on the original bill and stated we were a no show on the last night. When my boyfriend called to rectify this situation, they stated it would take 3 days to clear this up. He's still waiting... In summation, this is a lovely hotel but the problems that we experienced during our stay would probably deter us from booking at this hotel again if it was strictly for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: JennBrian0609
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were going to a Sunday afternoon baseball game and we decided to head down to Baltimore the day before and make a day of it. We looked at hotels and we decided to go with the Hilton. The website looked great and c'mon, it was the Hilton! Well when we got there our room was not ready. So we waited a while and asked for the key to the pool as we were waiting. An hour and a half later, still no call that our room was ready. So we headed back to the front desk to see what was going on. The lady at the desk informed us that our room was not ready and she did not know when it would be ready. I said I would like to speak to the manager and she replied "I am the manager and i am telling you the room is not ready." As a manager also, I could never speak to my customers that way! I asked why couldn't they just send someone to clean the room so we could get in. She just kept saying they are working on it. She never made eye contact and not once did we receive an apology from anyone about our situation. We were to have a room with a view of the harbor, and we got put into a room where we saw the back side of the baseball stadium. I could not believe how every acted as though there was no emergency in getting a room cleaned for us and no apologies at all. I expected better from a Hilton. We will not return to this Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: golferperry
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Baltimore Hilton for 5 nights. The hotel is literally across the street from Camden Yards, so if you want to see an Orioles game, this is the place to stay. In addition, many of their rooms overlook the outfield of the stadium; and from their Hilton Honors lounge on the 18th floor, you can see the entire field and game. The hotel is just a few blocks from the Inner Harbor, and it's an easy walk. It's also convenient to the Light Rail that runs to the airport. We ate breakfast several times in the 18th floor lounge, and also stopped by for some afternoon snacks. The attendants did a good job of keeping everything stocked. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you want a hotel close to the downtown Baltimore attractions and/or Camden Yards, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Baseball City”
Reviews.Author: ENVIROCLEAR
Reviews.Content: Stay here for baseball games and get a field view. The fireworks are spectacular viewed from your room

Reviews.Title: “Arrived at 6:30 and our room isn't ready!”
Reviews.Author: mizbailey
Reviews.Content: All week I looked forward to attending the NBA Conference with my husband and celebrating my birthday tomorrow and our 21st wedding anniversary on Thursday while staying at the Hilton. We arrive tired but looking forward to heading to our room and then going out to dinner. Upon arrival we were told not only was our room still not ready at 6:30 pm but they were unable to let us know what time our room would be available. Unbelievable! So my husband and I wait outside while our luggage lingers in the lobby and an hour later we receive a call that our room is ready. We collect our keys head upstairs open the door and our room has two double beds. We're a married couple celebrating an anniversary. My husband calls the front desk they forward our call to the managers Voicemail I express my frustration with the service we've received thus far and requested that he calls us back. No response. This quality of service from a Hilton Hotel is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “OK rooms, staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: Catbert10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last week of July. The rooms were OK and the executive lounge has an OK but not great continental breakfast. The hotel has installed thermostat controls, meaning that the rooms don't get very cool. I had a couple of opportunities to speak with the front desk staff and they were not helpful, to the point of being rude. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Orioles Games”
Reviews.Author: brn679
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Baltimore is very convenient if you plan on going to a game, literally walk across the street and you're at the gate. Due to a few conventions in the hotel the check in line was long (prob about 20 minutes) but it appeared they were moving as quickly as they could and a good portion of the holdup was from tired and weary travelers. The room we were in was impeccably clean. As others have posted they were stingy on the towels but that would not stop me from coming back. The food at the lobby bar was average but good in a pinch. If attending a game head across the street to Pickles, food and drink are good and reasonably priced. The facility has a great fitness center which overlooks Camden Yards, the view can't be beat. The equipment seemed to be maintained well and the room was clean. The hotel was a short walk to the Inner Harbor, we walked there a few times during the day and late at night and felt safe at either time. Overall if returning to Baltimore we would stay here again if we had plans on seeing a ballgame since the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary Hilton”
Reviews.Author: paradoxcapt
Reviews.Content: The main advantage of this hotel is that it is literally right next to Camden Yards ballpark and the Convention Center. It is about 5 blocks from the Inner Harbor. If there is a large convention in town or there is a baseball game, be prepared for lots of crowds, activity, and noise. Ask for a room overlooking the ballpark and make sure you get above the 10th floor if you want that view. Hotel itself is typical, standard Hilton business room, nothing special. Still which they had more readily accessible power outlets. They have the one in the lamp at the desk and that is it. Charging up the computer, phone, and iPod is a challenge. Staff was reasonably friendly, but not overly helpful. Everything worked in the room, which is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR CAMDEN YARDS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Momtwoboyz
Reviews.Content: Took our first trip to Camden Yards this year. Not knowing Baltimore at all, I chose the hotel closest to the Park. We only had to walk across the street and there we were. As a matter of fact if you were in the hotel's work out room/pool, you could actually watch a game if there was one going on across the street. Hotel staff was very friendly. Our room had a great view of the harbor. My only problem is that after being in the car for over 8 hours due to traffic, then actually having to drive around for another 15 minutes because all streets were blocked due to a game in progress, we were told that the only room they had was a king and it wasn't cleaned yet (6pm), and I had booked a double...after a short conference with the manager, they had a room for us that was clean and ready. Never had enough towels or toilet paper in the room either which I thought was bit strange..... Room was clean enough, but not sparkling.... within walking distance of the harbor also.

Reviews.Title: “Night Mare, absolutle Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: LaurelAnderson
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to attending a convention this past week. Arrival wait to check in 30 mintues. Room was not ready upon arrival. When it was room was filthy. Housekeeping services came up and said sorry, and made a half attempt to rectify. Dont ask for anything because if you do, they will treat you awful! Our confrence included internet and when asked why I was charged, they said because I used it. Only after bringing it to the attnetion of confrence mgnt did they agree that it was included and remove the charge and Hotel staff makes it seem like they did me a favor. Staff were rude, elevators were not fully operational and for a 3 year old hotel is very outdated. What convention center has no spa? Considering the confrence was for handicap rooms were anything but.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to inner harbor, pool was closed...in July...may come back”
Reviews.Author: OnTheGoSportsMom
Reviews.Content: Drove up from Richmond to take my daughter and her friends to see a concert a Rams Head Live. Check in was very smooth adn the front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We were only 6-7 blocks from the inner harbor (15 minutes). Room was pricey and we didn't get the harbor or ball park view. I booked this hotel for the pool because it is a huge lap pool. Dropped the girls off at the concert and came back to swim only to find out that it was closed for servicing. Really? Very close to tons of restaurants but everything is pretty expensive. Cheapest option was Subway. Rooms were clean and the internet service connected very fast. Which I needed so I could work when we arrived. Beds were comfortable but all the pillows were stinky. Like armpits. THe only thing I hated was that the housekeeping crew started knocking on the doors at 8:50 (repeatedly) when checkout wasn't until 12noon. Overall good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Nice......but”
Reviews.Author: sevilla69
Reviews.Content: Things were very clean at this hotel. nice view of and right at the ballpark. I found it odd how stingy they were with things. Had to make 2 calls for toilet paper, then the girl at services acted like she didn't believe me that we needed it. Same with the towels and the shampoo. Room was turned and only 2 towels left with 4 people in the room, and no shampoo even though we clearly left the empties in plain sight. Also, 6 elevators and only 2 or 3 running making wait time to get up to room a little long

Reviews.Title: “Total nightmare and still not satisfied”
Reviews.Author: tihayes
Reviews.Content: I planned on staying at this Hilton for 2 nights and seeing the Orioles vs. Red Sox on the second night. Unfortunately, my flight was cancelled, but I quickly notified the hotel that I would not be arriving until after 11pm. When I arrived about 11:30pm, I was told that all the rooms were "sold out" and they could not accomodate us. Not acceptable considering I had called earlier to confirm and also pre-paid and made my reservations 3 months prior. They offered to pay for the cab and shipped me to another hotel across town. Very unhappy. They agreed to credit me for 1 night, but I have still not seen any credit to my account. I will call next week and follow up. If you plan on arriving late, don't expect a room. I was told that if guests wanted to extend their stay, "they couldn't just kick them out"! What about people that made reservations?? Room was clean, location was amazing, Management needs to take a good hard look at the lack of caring for guests that are waiting for rooms or arrive late. Lobby was jam packed with people waiting for rooms when I transferred back to the hotel for the second night. Totally unacceptable and no excuse for not saving my room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect any smiling faces or quick check-ins at this location”
Reviews.Author: VATravellers3
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its location. It has location, otherwise, it not meet our expectations for a Hilton. Our rooms were not ready at the promised check-in time of 4:00. Even with our Hilton Honors check-in line the line wait was more than 20 minutes. (The regular check-in line was three times as long.) Each time we returned to check about the status of our room, we had to wait in line again. We were told we could check out bags in at the bell cap desk while we waited ****for a fee***! By the third attempt to get into the room we had made reservations for over 3 months ago, the desk clerk had to physically go up and check to see if our room was ready. This was past 6:15 pm and we had tickets to the baseball game that evening. We were offered nothing for our troubles-no verbal apologies, no monetary compensation, nothing. We never saw a manager or supervisor at the registration desk or in the lobby. The rooms were satisfactory, however, they are not sound proof as we could hear regular noises from the room above us and in the hallway. There was no one at the concierge desk when we needed assistance navigating the local area. A sign on the concierge desk stated help was available at the registration desk. Really? That long line? We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good..if you were there for a convention”
Reviews.Author: NYWanderer1
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was just so-so. Nothing amazing. The cleaning ladies took our bath mat and never replaced it. Had to call up for an iron and then tried to use the ironing board and it wasn't functioning so I used the bed. It was supposed to be the view of the harbor but we couldn't see much from our 11th floor stay. With all the convention folks, the elevators took forever and one night we just opted to tackle 11 flights of stiars instead. It was sad though when we asked a man in a uniform that read "security" where the stairs were and he pointed us to ones that were locked.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could do better on operations management”
Reviews.Author: InnChaser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we were going to two ball games with friends who live in the area. They recommended the hotel as it is next to the Orioles' ball park and has a good reputation. We liked our room, which looked over the ball field of Camden Yards. We booked the Great Get Away, and used Hilton Honors. While the beds were great, one of the drawbacks, as has been noted, is a lack of King sized beds. Our room had no fridge, which would have been nice during the scorching heat wave. Alas, all hotels make money at the bar. The breakfast restaurant, which was in the Tavern, had good food, reasonably-priced, but we had the package that included a breakfast. However, the management did not anticipate a huge crowd of people coming for the ball games, and since Red Sox fans always go to Baltimore for games, it was amazing that the staff could not cope with all the people who wanted breakfast. We got in just as a crowd was forming and waited 30 minutes for a table. In the entrance to the tavern, there were no roped-off areas for people to queue up for a seating, and since people who had already signed in just milled around that reception area, new guests arriving just stood behind them, thinking it was a line. Other guests, including us, clued them in as to what to do, as the staff did not seem to know new people had arrived and were overwhelmed anyway. Another detractor is the lap pool, which was inundated with children, and frankly, quite "murky". I would not be surprised if a health inspector would visit soon. The life guard sat around listening to her ipod and checking her emails while children tried to climb on each others' backs and "drown" each other by pushing their heads under water and also losing their balancel with heads nearly hitting the side of the pool. On the plus side, the fitness center was well-equipped, very clean, and had wonderful views. After the ball game, the six main elevators were also queued up and one was very slow and could not handle 15 people in it. So, it was, unfortunately, more than a little chaotic right after a game. I must say that the hotel staff were all extremely courteous, especially the doormen and women, and also the front desk people and all were quite helpful. The restaurant chef at the omelette table was excellent. They all made the stay a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Bumps in the road....”
Reviews.Author: tennisdude101
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Hilton in Baltimore for the Red Sox Orioles game the past few days. We stayed at the Hilton before and were eager to return. We live an hour away, so I thought an early check in would be acceptable since we wanted to enjoy our afternoon in the city before the game. I called ahead and asked if early check in was available, and my request was denied, which i found odd. We arrived around 2:30pm, parked, and went to the inner harbor for lunch. We got back to the hotel around 4:00 to check in. We found a long line of unfortunate people in our situation. There was a fireman's conference, and many of the people in the conference were late checking out. This resulted in many people not being check in to their rooms at 4:00. My girlfriend and I waited 1 hour and 45 minutes for our room to be cleaned and available. The rooms are very comfortable with new amenities. This was the main reason for our return to the hotel. We stayed two nights in 2009 for the Red Sox games and raved to our friends about the Hilton. However, upon arriving to our room, it smelled like cigarette smoke and was obvious to my girlfriend, and the two friends who we attended the game with who came up with us for drinks that it smelled like smoke. There was no time to report the problem since we had limited time before the game started at 7:05 After the game we walked across the street back to our room and reported the problem of the cigarette smoke from the previous guests. Our response from housekeeping was that the hotel was non smoking and an okay. The beds were comfortable. My girlfriend slept well. I would have slept well except for the pillows.... bring your own if you rely on good pillows to sleep well. Things were better the second day (Wednesday) We checked out of the hotel, and the front desk was nice enough to waive our parking fee because of the inconvenient check in, which I was very appreciative that they did that for us. After we left, the Red Sox won and all was right with the world until later when I got home. (aka 20 minutes ago) I checked my bank, and I was charged a 50 dollar fee from the Hilton for a "discretionary charge". When I called the Hilton to inquire about the phantom fee, the polite woman on the phone said it would have been for room service or something of that nature. We never ordered room service or anything of the sort. She assured me it would be taken off my account in the next few days as it was a pending charge. *Note to concierge or management, I know you read trip advisor reviews to check for quality control... I would appreciate it if this matter was taken care of immediately. I stayed in room 504 from 7/19-7/20. I travel to Baltimore whenever the Red Sox are in town. If you value your customers, please fix this problem. It is what prompted me to write this review..... Like the last reviewer stated, I will give the Hilton another chance only because of the rooms, the location to Camden Yards, and the Inner Harbor. Its a beautiful new hotel, the staff needs to be on their game for big events.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: ctguest1965
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Hilton. On the negative side, beds are only doubles--very difficult for 2 people to sleep comfortably in the same bed. My teenagers thought the double bed was a major drawback. Also, despite the fact that we had 4 people in our room, every single day there were only 3 washcloths and towels. We called multiple times to remedy this and they were not quick with bringing the washcloths to our room and they never came on the first call. When you are spending over $200 a night, you expect that somewhere in the hotel there will be free internet service--not here. They charge you $7.00 for 15 minutes of internet. This is a service that you can get for free at McDonald's but must pay for at a $200+ a night hotel. I find this unacceptable. We had access to the executive lounge and found that the first day there was nothing to eat. When I arrived there were 2 croissants and one blueberry yogurt, that was it. A short time later, though, they did replenish things. On the plus side, the hotel is clean. The lobby has a lot of wasted space. It would be nice if there were smaller furniture groupings with free internet access there. Also, a few times I found there was no one at the concierge desk. A huge plus is the view of Camden Yards., You feel like you are in the ballpark. One night we watched an entire game from the patio of the hotel. Many odd-numbered rooms have a beautiful view of the park. It is very convenient. If you are in town for a baseball game, I would recommend the hotel. If you are not a baseball fan, you might want to see what else is out there, but this is not a bad hotel. I might stay there again, if I wanted to see a game.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View of Camden Yards, But Missing Some Hilton Honors Perks.”
Reviews.Author: Abc123XYZ3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Baltimore for a family weekend get-away. The public areas in the hotel, such as the lobby and pool are well maintained, as are the individual rooms. Our room had a nice view of Camden Yards. The hotel staff were friendly. However, the weekend that we stayed at the hotel, there was a large convention at the hotel. The front desk was not adequately staffed to deal with all the guests. Because the Hilton Honors desk was not available at all for check-in on the afternoon of our arrival, check-in was twice as long for everyone since both Honors and non-Honors guests had to wait in the same line. Although we had booked a couple of months in advance, no rooms were available on the executive floor because they had been given out to convention guests. However, we were offered the typical Hilton Honors continental breakfast on the Executive Floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but needs a bit of improvement”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel057
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a getaway weekend with plans to attend some baseball games. The hotel is adjacent to Oriole Park and I felt very safe at all times. Check-in was a nightmare. Realizing that I arrived before the 4 pm usual check-in, the front desk staff apologized for not being able to afford me early check-in as a Hilton Honors member... the front desk staff said they had a large convention and were very busy with the large turnover. They did a pre-check-in and stated they would call my cell phone when my room was ready......I waited 1 1/2 hours and at 4 pm inquired at Reception. The man was very polite, but had to telephone the housekeeping supervisor to find out if the room was ready. It was ready and I was given room key and on the elevator ride, discovered that quite a few others were also waiting for rooms. I do understand that things happen and we all have a bad day, but when your business includes large groups of people for conferences, you must be able to get the job done. The room was beautifully decorated and clean and the hotel location is great....I will give them another chance if I'm ever back in Baltimore in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Forget Convenient Gym Access Here. Would never stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: hinrgmike
Reviews.Content: In today's era of service focus and healthy lifestyles affirmation, it is unbelievable that this aspiring "upscale" trendy oriented Hilton has such an outdated gym/fitness policy. Closes at 10pm no exceptions. That may have been the norm a decade ago, but now days most hotels of this size and caliber are understanding trends in lifestyles and consumer needs and offering 24hr key pass access. But obviously this hotel is either clueless or just does not care. As a HHonors gold member, this has been one of my worst experiences and would never stay here again. There are much better options to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel. Clean and modern.”
Reviews.Author: Mangocatpurring
Reviews.Content: This property is right at the habor. Pubs across the street and attached to the convention center. Loved this hotel. Beds were comfortable. I do not drink the coffee from the room and it was difficult to find coffee and was $3 a cup. For me, this is an issue. I like my coffee in the morning. When I did find it,by crossing the street and wandering around for a while, it was good coffee. Wifi was at a cost even for HHonors members. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mlgtexas
Reviews.Content: I stay at hilton hotels about 60 nights a year all over the country and this is one of the nicest. I really enjoyed the view of the ballpark and the great fitness room. The hotel public areas and rooms are updated, clean and very comfortable. I will definately stay here again when in town. My only complaint is that the concierge lounge breakfast was not as nice as others I have experienced. Very limited breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel great views, lounge so -so”
Reviews.Author: christykane
Reviews.Content: stayed here last week and got to the executive level which was nice as they had lounge and great views of the stadium as well as the 4th floor u can catch the game. the only draw back i had was. that normally you pay extra to stay on concierge level type of room and the executive lounge was ok . and you had to pay for adult beverage . which were like 5 or 6 a piece. which i was like they should have included it for free . or a least given you 2 drinks per person . I mean you pay extra to stay up their? so why would that not be included . ? as it can be an average of 150 extra on top of hotel price.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Rating Justified”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Crab
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel in all respects. A bit pricey at over $250 per night, but look for deals from the discounters especially during the week. We got the same room for $95. The location is fantastic for a Baltimore visit, especially if you are a baseball fan. It is right across the street from Camden Yards. Consierge did not have any tickets (which I thought was unusual), but there were plenty of hawkers on the street right outside the entrance. It is also just a block from all the trendy sports bars adjacent to the ballpark, i.e. Pickles, Score, and Sliders. Sliders is our favorite. Friendly wait staff, good cook, excellent bartenders, and very reasonable prices. We suggest the crab cake sliders, the cheeseburger sliders, and the hot wings. And they have Natty Boh on draft for $2 a glass. Get your food and fill up on beer there before you go to the game and pay double or triple for food and drink. There are also street vendors offering delicious polish sausages with sauteed peppers and onions, hot dogs, hamburgers, water, sodas, peanuts, etc. You can bring anything you want into Camden Yards, except glass bottles and alcohol. I hope they don't change that rule anytime soon. It's one of the few sports stadiums that allow it. The hotel has a very nice bar and cafe that stays open long after the game is over. They make the best Cappacino Martini in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/view”
Reviews.Author: jgallag
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The baseball view rooms (odd numbered rooms) are great! You are RIGHT next to the stadium!! If you can get an executive room view, get it. The best is if you can be upgraded. This is a 4 year old hotel and it shows. Meaning it looks new! Great location to the inner harbor, Orioles game, and Raven stadium. The pool and gym (4th floor) are great. Next to the gym is an open veranda where you can see the Orioles game. We decided not to go to the game and just relax at the veranda. Questions, let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Numbers are Best!”
Reviews.Author: 2toots
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is in a great location, convenient to Camden Yards and the waterfront. Walking around the area is not a problem and there is a lot of stuff to see and do. We were in town for one night and had a Ballpark view and attended the game. We've also stayed here and had a city view as well. With a quick one night stay, there were no complaints. It's a busy hotel that has a fair amount of conventions going on. Valet parking is available as well as self-park. Bellhops and Valets greet you when you pull in. Depending on how busy they are, check-in could take awhile. I waited roughly 15 minutes...the concierge was out so the front desk was being helpful to a guest and giving her directions and suggestions...I wasn't in that much of a rush, so it didn't bother me. Rooms are good sized, nicely decorated. I used the stairs a lot and noticed a smell of smoke ( I think someone was too lazy to go outside). We had access to the Executive Lounge. My only complaint....we hit some traffic snarls and weren't going to check in until late. I called the hotel to see what time the lounge closed and was told it was open late. I asked if there would be 'snacks, like cheese and crackers, etc' out so we could grab something quick before dinner. I was told they would be out all night. When I got to the lounge, just cookies and soda were available. I guess I was given the wrong information, no big deal. Breakfast in the Lounge was ample, bagels, sweets, yogurt, fresh fruit..and slow toasters, enough to start the day. We did go to the bar and ordered a pizza...it hit the spot, considering we didn't feel like walking too far and it was getting late. They also have 'harbor view' rooms, which I was told you really can't see the harbor, they just face that way. I would return to the Hilton again, and I am looking forward to spending more than just 1 night here to fully enjoy the city, its' surroundings and this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Karjan83
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Hilton Baltimore and have nothing but high ratings for the Hotel.. The hotel was very nice, clean and staff was very friendly. we used the pool and fitness center and everything was very clean..Great location we got to watch the Orioles game from the patio off the fitness room which was very relaxing.. i would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, esp. at Priceline rate of $100”
Reviews.Author: Jules034
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night, so didn't have chance to use many of the hotel's amenities. The room was spacious, bed comfortable, bathroom clean and up to date. Water coming out of the shower was an unappealing yellow color when it pooled in the bathtub, however. Staff was helpful, including the bell staff helping me with checking bags and getting cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Much-improved! Expensive, but clean and comfortable and pet-friendly. Wonderful pool. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: dessi_9
Reviews.Content: Two years ago, we stayed at this hotel, and the bathroom was not clean. But the manager kindly responded to our review, and since then the bathrooms have always been nice and clean. Thank you so much for listening to your customers, Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Plusses and minusses”
Reviews.Author: NJFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: Ran a conference here recently. Very nice hotel, apparantly brand new (within the last 2 years). Staff helpful and always nice - although not the quickest of the bunch. Not a problem, just a bit odd (When asked if there is a wait at the restaurant they say 'don't know, probably depends on how many people they have there'. Yes, of course, but is there someone in the hotel who might be able to tell me? Perhaps you could transfer me to the restaurant? 'Oh, sure!' ). VERY nice bathroom amenities that were generously replenished. Location not bad - quick 5 minute walk to the harbor. Orioles stadium right next door for those who like that sort of thing. Unfortunately traffic and street noise come through the windows very strong - BRING EARPLUGS if you are sensitive to noise. My room was skipped by the maid one day (which is disappointing when I left at 6AM and came back at 7:30PM for a 30 minute break before going back to work) and this happenned to another colleague of mine 2 days in a row. (And no, we did not leave out our 'do not disturb' signs as the staff kept insinuating) If you're planning a conference here - severe lack of water and trashcans throughout the entire venue. Staff are slow to respond to requests. Management is helpful and very nice but seemed disconnected at times. AV team is good. Overall would stay here again - but only if someone else is paying!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice... overlooks Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: Megan S
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Baltimore on business for one night and chose the Hilton Baltimore since I am a Hilton Honors member. Check in was very smooth, and the staff greeted by name (not overly important to me, but I did notice). The lobby is huge with a bar that appears to serve food...very modern. The rooms were very nice although I receive a room with two queen size beds. This was my only compliant as my preference is a king size, but for one night it was not a problem. The rooms are spacious with a desk and large picture window. Many rooms have a fantastic view of Camden Yards. Stay here if you are going to an Oriels game! Overall, it was fine for a one night business trip, and I would plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Right next to the Oriole's Ballpark”
Reviews.Author: Hoagy74
Reviews.Content: When you get here, all you can say is Location, Location, Location. The ballpark at Camden yards is literally footsteps from the door. You can even see the park and watch a game from the workout center and the executive lounge. It's about 1/2 mile hike down to Inner Harbor and the hotel validated our parking for the entire day after we checked out. The hotel is comfortable and the staff is friendly. The snacks in the executive lounge are pretty typical without being the over the top that we have seen in some locations. The continental breakfast is also pretty modest with breads, pastries, and cereal being your main fare with a little side of fruit or yogurt. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Our window gave a lovely view of the Bromo Seltzer tower. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for baseball fans.”
Reviews.Author: OriolesFan1990
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel back in the summer of 2010. My room had an excellent view of Cambden Yard and is right across from the stadium. You could actually watch batting practice from my window. The hotel was clean and the staff was curious. The bellhops were very efficent. I paid for a club room for a small fee, and it had snacks and liquor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, But.....”
Reviews.Author: Westfam1
Reviews.Content: My wife and recently decided to take our son to his first Orioles game. To make the experience a memorable one, we deciced to stay at the Hilton in a suite that overlooks Oriole Park at Camden Yards. The room was very nice with a comfy bed and Awesome view of the stadium. The walk to the gates was maybe two minutes, tops. The experience was all that we had hoped for. But, when we left, my wife noticed that she had left an article of clothing in the closet. We contacted the hotel but there was NO BLOUSE there. We may still stay at the Hilton, but we will not forget to check the closet or leave anything unattended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: randyandjulie
Reviews.Content: Great location for a visit to the city especially if it is tied in with a ballgame! Beds are very very comfy with lots of fluffy nice pillows! Walking distance to the harbor where you have several dinning options. Lots of bars and pubs within walking distance scattered in every direction. Hotel has a restaurant but it's a bit pricey stayed clear. Parking is extra and expensive (28 per day) internet is also extra (11.95 p/d). Free wifi at the Lobby bar which opens early evening and offers happy hour and lite fare. Rooms are clean and comfy but we were subjected to a large number of teens visiting the city for volleyball tryouts... walking quietly in the halls was not an option! A fridge in the room would have been nice but the safe in the closet was appreciated. All in all a nice place for a fun wknd away.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: K F
Reviews.Content: The thing that stood out most to me about my stay here was that every single staff member I encountered in this hotel was friendly and helpful. I arrived early and was hoping to check in early to freshen up for a meeting , but the hotel was at capacity and they were issuing rooms as they were cleaned. The front desk did their best to get me into a room as soon as possible, and I was able to check in instead of brushing my teeth in the lobby bathroom. The cleaning staff said hello in the hallways. The bellmen always greeted you and opened the door. The gift shop clerk recommended a great place to grab a sandwich a few blocks away (Potbellys - do it!). Every single person seemed to want to make your stay more enjoyable; it felt like I was at the Ritz. The rooms are very generously sized, clean, and the bed was comfortable. Plenty of outlets, and ample lighting. Nice bathroom amenities. Huge TV. In-room coffee was tasty. You cannot beat the location, esp if you are traveling for a convention. You can even access the convention center through a series of walkways without ever having to go outside...which is great in the winter! If I'm back in Baltimore, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Updated and Upscale”
Reviews.Author: buffgray
Reviews.Content: Located across the street from Camden Yards. We stayed in a regular room on the 9th floor. The room was updated versus other hotels in the area. The bed is firm with various soft pillows. The TV is a flat screen with roughly 30-40 channels. The bathroom is standard with updated countertops and tiles. A hairdryer is provided in the bathroom in a drawer. There is a electronic safe in the closet. The vending machine only contains drinks and is located next to the ice machine. We had room service one night. The food was average and took over forty minutes to arrive to the room. The room service tray was placed in the hallway in the evening and remained in the hall at least until 10AM the following morning. Check in and check out was quick and easy. The front desk was very helpful with any questions. Garage parking was $28/day. Would recommend the Hilton for anyone attending Orioles games.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: Hotel is within walking distance to the Inner Harbor and right next to the Orioles stadium. Staff were friendly and rooms were very clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER and Trying To Forget!”
Reviews.Author: blueroanvet
Reviews.Content: I am a constant business traveler, Hilton Diamond Member, and stay on the road most every week. I stayed at the Hilton Baltimore Inner Hotel in December 2010 for a major conference and was staying here with a large group of colleagues. I had my own room. Hotel is very stark and industrial, which may be just the feel of Baltimore. My room was typical Hilton, but not overly nice given the newness of the hotel. My stay was uneventful until I discovered jewelry missing from my luggage in my hotel room-my engagement ring and anniversary bracelet. I reported the items missing after a thorough search of my room and asking myself if I could be wrong. The hotel clerk was interested, and told me who to contact. I had a VERY definite time frame and location where the items went missing and reported all details to the Head of Safety and Security in charge. I submitted all requested information, written and otherwise, to him, and also filed a police report with Baltimore police. I was told he housekeeper who cleaned my room was "questioned and said she didn't take it" and that was it. I got one phone call from the Hotel ownership (a lawyer) who had my information and said that there was nothing more the hotel could do. Their insurance would "turn it over to my insurance" and that was that. My insurance paid the claim, and I never got even a written apology. Absurd. All I was told was "there was a safe in the room--were you aware of it?" No, I was not , as it was located in the very corner of a closet, and I never thought that someone would access my room, rifle through my belongings, and steal the only real jewelry I had with me during a busy conference for me. I have never had this problem at any other Hilton, and boy, have I learned this the hard way! Whoever did this KNEW WHAT TO LOOK FOR and has probably done this before as they ONLY took the two pieces of real jewelry I had, and left all the costume. I made this statement to security implying a "ring" of professional thieves, and they said nothing. Hilton never apologized and essentially blamed me for the incident! They never paid a dime! DO NOT STAY here if you value your belongings and don't want thieves in your suitcase. I will NEVER stay at this Hilton again as they obviously condone theft and consider it "No big deal." I also tell all my fellow road warriors that this hotel employs a professional thief. Have fun during your stay and lock all your belongings up!! Now I am in the process of "re-building" my engagement ring, and dealing with the aftermath. I am devastated at the theft of my original ring and so is my now husband. THANKS Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Baltimore --> overlooking Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: ToddBu
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Baltimore is a great hotel located next door to camden yards and is within walking distance, 3-4 blocks, of the inner harbor. Our room was on the 20th floor looking into the Camden Yards from the outfield, very cool view. The interior of the lobby, bar, restaurant, and rooms are all extremely nice as the hotel is fairly new. The fitness center is nice and the restaurants were good. My only complaints are the parking and exec lounge. The parking is steep: $30/night. I would suggest taking the train to the hotel as the MARC Camden stop is only 1 block away. I was also not that impressed with the executive lounge breakfast. It was included in my room and I ended up preferring to pay for my own breakfast. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great employees, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: taraship
Reviews.Content: First of all, I got this hotel for $99/night through Priceline so that contributes to my review and, perhaps, my satisfaction. Regardless, I thought this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in, mostly because of how friendly the staff was, from the porter who met us in the parking garage to the cleaning woman (got into a discussion about cats with her). Everyone was just very nice. The hotel/room itself was clean and comfortable. The lobby wasn't very exciting but I was at a conference without much time to hang out in the lobby. It was a little confusing to find some of the meeting rooms but whenever I asked a staff member, they were extremely helpful. One guy even made fun of me (nicely) for mispronouncing the name of one room. I also organized a catered event and the coordinator was in constant communication with me while also helping me coordinate a menu that was within my budget. He also waived some fees so I could remain in that budget. I really can't go on enough about how great the staff was and well they took care of me. I also heard the same from several of my colleagues. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent new Hilton in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nads82
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is brand new and was well designed. It is located near the Harbor and next to Camden Yards. I had a great night of sleep and enjoyed the cleanliness and new amenities. Staff were very helpful, self parking was easy, and they accepted the government rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 10 minute walk to the inner harbor. The area is a little sketchy, so limit your walking between the inner harbor and hotel after dark. Jimmy Johns nearby! Rooms are clean and quiet, well appointed. The hotel is next to the convention center. Self parking is easy. Hotel is about 15 minutes from the airport. All around good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, very friendly staff, but a few odd inconsistencies.”
Reviews.Author: junodee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Baltimore in connection with a business meeting. While I often don't sleep well in hotels, this was one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. Fabulous. The location is very good with walking access to the Inner Harbor and sports arenas. The staff was uniformly gracious and very friendly and made me feel happy to be back in Baltimore. I would definitely return. That being said, when I arrived around 8 pm and popped into the Executive Lounge hoping for some snacks, there were only some small offerings of nuts, crackers, one banana and several oranges. A glass of wine was $10-12. I guess i expected a bit more than that as other hotels often have hot food and a more diverse offering of food and drinks. The breakfast was similarly limited and the bread that I ate was not very fresh. I've had better breakfasts at some of the less expensive hotel chains. My room was not huge, but still quite nice--although there was a hole in the sheets--not a big deal, but it made the experience of being on the Concierge level feel less than 100% high-end in quality. Parking was pricey, but then so is most of the parking in downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moxiefe1
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel. Restaurant is very good. Convenient to Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff, wonderful catered food!”
Reviews.Author: EdnaJune
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at the Baltimore Hilton to be some of the friendliest, most helpful and professional I've encountered anywhere. The catered meal I had during the course of my business there was also without a doubt the best hotel food I've ever eaten! Truly outstanding. While the hotel is overall very clean, the carpet in my room is showing signs of needing to be replaced. The one thing I don't like about this hotel is the charge for internet usage. Not only is there a charge, but it is outrageously high!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wvfolks
Reviews.Content: We come to Baltimore several times a year, most often for theatre. We decided on the Hilton based upon location. The room was fabulous, very clean and well appointed. We enjoyed the Lobby bar. We had dinner in the Diamond Tavern and it was excellent, far exceeding expectations. The best hotel dinning we have had. The best thing about your hotel is the staff. Every staff person we encountered was friendly and helpfull. This most definitely will be our hotel og choice in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel and conference space”
Reviews.Author: SimonSez24
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Baltimore Hilton and was very impressed. You can tell the rooms were updated recently. The rooms were spacious and mine even had a new car smell! I do have to comment on the conference aspect of the trip. We had over 550 conference attendees and I do not know if the dining staff was prepared to handle us! We had to wait on lines for our drinks (cash bar) and it really irritated me that I had to wait online for 15 minutes just to get one drink. I missed the beginning of my dinner with my colleagues and had to sit with strangers because of these ridiculously long lines. I would seriously attempt to work on the flow of these practices. Parking cost was a little high (this was the off season..no game in town and we still had to pay $14.00 for parking).

Reviews.Title: “Cold shower”
Reviews.Content: A cold shower was the last thing I needed on a winter morning but that is what I had. I was offered coffee but that required a trek to the east wing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, disappointing and frustrating experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler113
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight on New Year’s Eve looking forward to a wonderful experience, especially since we reserved a room on the Executive level. We expected to check in with the concierge (as indicated in the room description) to avoid lines, but were told there was no such thing. Then, even though we were there at 3pm, the desk had no idea when our room would be ready. The lounges weren’t open so we sat in the lobby waiting for a call. After 4pm, we asked the desk again when the room would be ready—they said it was listed as ready and didn’t know why we were not called. She did say that we should be happy though b/c our room was upgraded—I told her that we had paid in advance for that level room. Then we tried to go upstairs to the room and had to wait for the third elevator, since bell hops cut in front of us with large luggage racks to get their tipping customers in first. I understand they were dealing with a large religious group, a big wedding, and a holiday night all in one. However, we were still surprised that the following morning the hotel’s water pumps shut down. Some of the water that did come through was discolored. We spent a couple hours waiting for the shower to work before finally giving up and checking out. Several calls to the manager that morning were made and he did try to make things better. He comped our parking and offered a lunch voucher at the hotel restaurant (seemed less than desirable given the water trouble). He said our room could have been partially comped but was ineligible b/c we had prepaid. The room itself was very clean and well-appointed, in a nice area of the city near attractions. The view of Camden Yards at sunset was amazing. It was disappointing that the other factors ruined the stay. I’d recommend the hotel if you’re looking for a clean room and not necessarily a top notch experience. At the very least, DO NOT pay extra for concierge level service—the regular customer service needs to be figured out first. The Executive Level just means the elevator has to travel longer to your room. Also, expect to pay for in-room internet--their free internet is 15 minutes in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: taurean2003
Reviews.Content: That sums it up! From the doorman who retrieved my bags to checkout, every staff member was friendly, acomodating, and extremely helpful. The hotel is immaculate and modern. Had a nice view of Inner harbor, even if it was 4 blocks away. 5-10 minute walk to Inner-Harbor with direct access to Convention Center, and Camden Yards right behind hotel. Great pool, except jacuzzi wasn't warm enough) and large workout area, nice restaurant, and bar. Minor drawback is that there is a WIFI charge of $10+ per day, which I don't feel is reasonable. What made the experience even more enjoyable is that I felt I was getting VIP attention since the occupany rate was below 30%! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and clean property in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: barbec105
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the major attractions in Baltimore's Inner Harbor. The decor was modern and the room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel has a nice Lobby Bar that had a nice mix of people on the Friday night that we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Souless But Super”
Reviews.Author: kohl57
Reviews.Content: OK, so it's a big convention hotel sans soul but we cannot fault the Baltimore Hilton after a two-day weekend stay. Handsome, brand new, great location (the new free Charm City Shuttle stops right outside and it's a short hop to the Inner Harbor or a 15-min pleasant walk), spotlessly clean, a huge, beautifully decorated room overlooking Orioles Park at Camden yards, perfect bathroom and uber efficient service from a pleasant staff. Public areas are very attractive although it's a bit odd having the restaurant across the street. The breakfast buffet excellent but we choose not to dine there for other meals as it's pretty characterless. A big plus here is the super spa facilities with a great gym, lovely indoor pool and sauna. And we paid $109 a night via Hotwire. Definately would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tcordero
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family while attending a conference. Able to check in without any problems, staff very courteous and informative. The room was clean upon check in and was cleaned promptly every day that was there. Very good location, Convention center right across the street. Inner harbor just a few blocks away, there is even a city bus that takes you there for free if you don't want to walk 4-5 blocks. Camden Yards was right across the street, so if baseball season was on, I would have liked to go check out a game. The price of $200/night is a little steep, but since my company was paying for it, no worries. The bar was a little small, and closed up a little early on a Friday night, but the bartender was fun to talk to. Room Service was good, again, prices are a bit steep for breakfast at $18 + tax and tip, but most hotels are the same way. There are plenty of restaurants across the street, for a lot cheaper if you can get up early enough. Overnight parking was also a crazy $26/night...Internet was also $12/night, it was comped since I booked an internet package deal. If not, I would not have logged on...I still don't see why it would not be complimentary already, most "smaller chain" hotels offer it for free...but that's been argued before I guess. If I were paying out of my pocket, I may have to look elsewhere to stay...or at least research more for the best deal. My family stayed with me, not a really child friendly hotel. We did check out the pool, was a little chilly, but the kids enjoyed the swim. It also had a great view of the ball park. Valet workers gave great suggestions as where to eat and gave great directions as far as where we wanted to go. People complained on previous posts about how thin the walls are, but we had no issues with it. Customer service was good, I believe in treating people how you would like to be treated. So if you have a problem, there is no reason to raise your voice at the workers, just being nice will usually yield you better responses that yelling. I have read posts where they say that so and so was rude, but we never encountered that.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service and a smile...NOT HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: bremuffin
Reviews.Content: Room not ready on time. Lobby was ridiculously crowded with check-ins and only a few people working the front desk. Will never stay here again. Plus side... room was super clean. WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE... not even an apology for our room not being ready until 4pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: salex19
Reviews.Content: I had a very short stay her with my husband. We sailed the Lukemia Cup from Annapolis to Baltimore and stayed at this hotel for a short night before heading back the next day. The service was excellent. My husband left his wallet in the cab and the hotel staff got it back to us, even though we were outside trying to figure out which cab company to call. Additionally, the woman at the check-in was so nice and professional. I had booked the room through priceline and wasn't sure I could use my HiltonHonors points, but she took care of it right away. I didn't even need my card. The room was very large and well appointed. The bed was fantastic and I slept like a baby. My only two complaints: bath tub was small and the walls were thin. In the morning we could hear the men next door very loudly (and this was early in the morning, I think they were going to the Ravens game).

Reviews.Title: “Great place esp if you want to be near Inner Harbor or Conv Center”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference just recently. The hotel is very new and modern. I'm a Hilton Honors member, so I got free internet and access to the concierge lounge on the 18th floor where this is breakfast and snack [but a cash bar :(]. The housekeeping was superb, and my room was made up by early morning. I valued this because there are often times during a conference that I want to go back to my room to work on things. The proxmity to the conv center is a big plus. I had meetings in the early morning or late at night, and it was nice to be so close to my room. Every part of the hotel is in good shape. The things I disliked were (1) the bar is kind of small and out of the way (2) The Diamond Tavern really is not very good. (3) For some reason the shower head is really high. I'm not tall, but not that short either (5'10"), and still was a bit of a reach to adjust. Finally, the room rate was $224 not including taxes. Because I was there on business, it didn't really matter to me, but if I were paying myself, I might try to explore some other options. But all in all I would recommend this hotel to business travellers or people who want to be near the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “no service for high rates”
Reviews.Author: Beth748
Reviews.Content: We had difficulty with getting our roome clean. We requested by phone twice and in person at the front desk twice. The room was cleaned after 9 pm one night. Each depatrment blamed the others and no one took responsibility and seemed to care. Would not return. Although close to the convetion center would walk from another area hotel next time. Expectation were not high and the hotel fell far below.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pretzellogix
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the IAPP conference in September. This hotel was a great business hotel, in a fantastic location. The baseball stadium is right next door, and you can actually watch games either from some of the rooms, or from the gym area. It was only a few minutes walking to the inner harbor and all the associated attractions. The light rail stop is literally right outside the hotel, and after that, it is only a 15 minute, $2 train ride to the airport. Considering the parking charges, and how easy it is to walk everywhere, there is absolutely no reason to rent a car if staying here and arriving to BWI. The conference facilities and catering were very nice and well laid out. The rooms were nice, clean, modern, with comfortable beds, and great views from ballpark rooms. Additionally, the snacks on the club floor were good, and the bartenders all had a generous pour. The only downsides? No minibars in the rooms. Bizarre. Also, no easy electricity plugs in the desks... something that should be standard in all modern hotels. The only options are moving the whole thing to access the plug behind it, or using a plug in the lamp, which doesn't work well with Apple chargers. The bathroom was tiny and poorly decorated, with a very shallow tub. Also, the food at the restaurant was not very good, there are much better options within a couple blocks. Overall, highly recommended for the location and the rooms. The staff were all very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Carla6779
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hilton Baltimore for our anniversary weekend get away. We loved the view of Orioles stadium right from the hotel and the best part was just walking right across the street to get to the game. The hotel staff was excellent and extremely helpful and when I realized 3 hours after we left that I had left something extremely important in my room I called the hotel and the security staff returned it to me the next day safe and sound! We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajeshshah65
Reviews.Content: Service was very good; Kids lived it; We enjoyed; Fitness center was very good and clean

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WS02
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Hilton with my wife as we wanted to catch an Orioles game and sightsee around the inner harbour. It was our first time in Baltimore. We loved the hotel due to its proximity to downtown's hotpots and stadium. The hotel is large, clean, very spacious and modern. Our room was overlooking the stadium and was spacious. The only negative aspect is the parking inside the hotel. It is a bit challenging to find due to traffic around the hotel and 1-way streets. The $30 price tag is a bit steep. The sound doesn't get inside and breakfast is great. I would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Unsatisfied Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: juliarh
Reviews.Content: This is billed as a business-friendly hotel - but they make you pay for wireless internet access and don't even have free wifi in the hotel lobby. In order to access the internet I would have had to pay $14 per day for my computer in my room (which I grudgingly did because I had work to do), and ALSO wireless access for my hand-held - because it counts as another "computer". The 3G signal was very poor within the hotel so I was scrambling when I needed to find directions to a restaurant. In desperation, I tried their business center, which was 2 (!) computers within a UPS Store (!!) where you still had to pay for internet access (!!!). The only thing you were permitted to do without charge at the business center was print a boarding pass. For a business hotel connected to a convention center, I thought that the business-level services were shockingly bad. I complained to the front desk staff, and got nowhere. They also made me pay $26 per day for parking. Ridiculous - this should be included in the charge for overnight guests. With that said, the room was comfortable and spotless - and the hotel itself is in a fantastic location. They should fix these trivial problems so that they can get the good ratings they would otherwise deserve.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: conferencetrip31
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and the flat screen TV was nice. The bed was not as comfortable as many other hotels--too hard. I could hear people in other rooms, though they weren't making too much noise. My coffee maker didn't have the ceramic mugs that I noticed in other rooms, so I asked the cleaning staff for some and never heard back. There was only one styrofoam cup in the room for two people to share. Room service was fine. Internet was not available in the rooms unless you paid extra (on top of a $250 room charge, this seemed excessive). The hotel's restaurant was the worst part. We were seated for over an hour before receiving our breakfast; others seated later were eating long before we were served. The coffee was so bad (weak and bitter) that it was not worth having--a good thing, since no server returned to offer refills. We asked for water three times before someone finally (an hour and a half into the meal) brought us two glasses (for a table of four).
