The food, when it finally came, was just okay--surprising for such expensive fare. The concierge desk was deserted on Saturday night, so we asked at the front desk for a restaurant recommendation and got nothing except a copy of the hotel's Baltimore guide. Overall, it felt grossly overpriced. I guess they can get away with this because they are connected to the convention center and right across the street from Camden Yards.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service and extra charges”
Reviews.Author: markmarymark55
Reviews.Content: A nice building but overpriced. $26/day to park in the garage, $14/day for wi-fi. Very uncouth staff. The restaurant was half full but the hostess told us to wait, walked away and never came back. So we ran up a $100 bill at another restaurant. My last Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: clsummergirl
Reviews.Content: We came down for the weekend to watch a couple Yankees games and go to the aquarium and could not have asked for a more perfect stay! We arrived earlier than we thought we'd get there, and figured we would have to hang out until we could check in. Luckily we decided to ask and they told us our room was available and we checked in at 1:00. Every single staff member we encountered was extremely polite and helpful. Our room was literally sparkling clean. Our housekeeper even noticed the birthday card I had gotten for my boyfriend and much to our surprise when we came back to the room after the ball game, there was a beautiful plate of chocolate covered strawberries with a happy birthday note from our housekeeper! I couldn't believe she noticed, and was thoughtful enough to do that! I slept like a baby in the bed and heard no noise besides some sirens during the night. It was a 5 minute walk to the Inner Harbor, and a minute to the ball park. I thought the parking was ridiculous at first ($26/day) but when I saw all the security and attendants in the garage, I was glad my car was in good hands. Great, great, great experience!! Would definitely without a doubt return and recommend! Pricey but worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for baseball game or harbor visit”
Reviews.Author: momto7
Reviews.Content: The hotel's fitness room as well as some of the hotel rooms overlook Camden Yards baseball field. We went to a game & saw the guests standing as they watched the game. Obviously, it's very convenient to stay after a game. The walk to the harbor is quick & safe, where we found many restaurants. Parking is $27 per night so we chose a lot nearby instead & saved a few bucks. I also booked this hotel on Hotwire & ended up paying $99 for the night...that was a great deal. The concierge was helpful. The front desk was busy but the wait was usually short. Our room even had a distant view of the harbor. All in all, it was a great stay. I would recommend visiting "Top of the World" for viewing the city & Fort McHenry if you like historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: IslandTraveler2
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Baltimore where I stayed two nights at the Baltimore Hilton, It was very close to the Inner Harbor, and was conveient to Mount Vernon which i also wanted to visit. But the hotel itself seem sterile, and at no time did it have a conciege on duty, even on a Monday. So I had to get help from the friendly Bell staff. My room was great and the housekeeper was helpful. The Diamond Tavern staff was great, especially my waiter on Sunday who made some helpful suggestions about my meal. But the hotel does not mention on its website the construction on Pratt Street, so if you are bothered by noise make sure that you get a room away from Pratt street since I could hear the construction noise even on the 14th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Sterile convention feel, otherwise solid & new hotel”
Reviews.Author: OSU_Sux
Reviews.Content: The temporary pain in the neck here is that there is road construction near the hotel and accessing it is nearly impossible. I had to circle the city core several times to try to get there. The staff was pretty blase about it saying it as the city's fault. I get that, but there management should be making it more obvious. There is a sign I saw on the road the next day, I guess that was put out there after I complained. The hotel looks good, reminds me of the international Hiltons I have stayed at - huge, sterile lobby, very international contemporary and devoid of any intimacy. The rooms are nice, great view of the ballpark if you get a south facing room. Executive Lounge is nice, but not very obvious as to its location on the 18th floor. The hotel is downtown and convenient to the convention center and sports facilities but I would advise staying at the Intercontinental or the Homewood/Hampton at Harbor East to get better access to the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tara2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Hilton for one night and actually considered extending my stay in Baltimore just because I liked the hotel so much. My husband and I were in town to see an Orioles game. The hotel is literally steps from the ballpark. On the 4th floor of the hotel, adjacent to the fitness center, there is a patio with tables and chairs that looks right into the ballpark. The fitness center has plenty of state-of-the-art equipment, a sauna and a pool with a hot tub. The hotel is within walking distance of the inner harbor. The room and the hotel in general were clean and in pristine condition. I recommend staying at this Hilton. We paid $169 for the night, which I believe was a great value for a hotel that nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: runaway_with_me
Reviews.Content: Arrived back from our cruise and only had a day in Baltimore, sadly, but were really happy with our stay at the Hilton. What a great view we had of Oriole Park at Camden Yards! We had paid extra for this, but it was totally worth it. If we didn't have tickets to the game against Texas that night, we would have just hung out in our room and watched the action. Breakfast was included, but we had to leave before 7am, so I can't comment, unfortunately. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Comfortabgle great location good service-a real Hilton”
Reviews.Author: KPEngland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here two nights last weekend and found this newish Hilton everything we expected. Excellent friendy and efficient welcome welcome and a quick check in. Great location-walking to Inner harbour area and adjacent to Orioles baseball. I especially liked the ability to view the game from the outside terrace--surely missing a trick with no drinks /food service here. Rooms of good size and very comfortable. Breakfast wasnt a stand out- no atmosphere and plenty of staff but talking to amongst themselves and service was friendly but not so good but this was the only blemish. High car parking and no free WIFI pushes the price up somewhat but we especially like the newer Hiltons and this was evrything we expected.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Hiltons”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoOrange
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to have a room fairly high-up, facing Camden Yards. Fantastic view. The hotel had good service, clean, lots of HD channels, strong WiFi, and quiet. As a loyal Hilton Family guy, it delivers everything I expect as the primary Hilton in town. I look forward to staying here again when possible.

Reviews.Title: “Made anime fans feel welcome!”
Reviews.Author: angelynx
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the Baltimore Hilton while attending the OTAKON anime fan convention held in the Baltimore Convention Center.. We originally chose the Hilton mainly for its convenient location, as it is connected to the Con Center by an enclosed bridgeway, However, we ended up being glad we had stayed there for many more reasons as well. The room was very comfortable with especially cozy beds. Elevator service was remarkably consistent throughout the weekend--except on departure day we never had to wait more than a few minutes for an elevator, amazing at a con of more than 29,000 people. Despite the quite outlandish look of many con-goers I never heard or saw any staff member treat a fan rudely; in fact they went out of their way to be polite and friendly, especially at the Diamond Tavern restaurant where we had breakfast both days. It's not a cheap place to eat but I still recommend it for the good food (including handmade omelets!) and cheerful service. Even the parking garage staff were extra nice and helpful. There was some noise from the hallways (as to be expected at a fan convention, but the room was quiet with no racket from adjoining rooms at all. I always appreciate a hotel that works to be "green" and the Hilton takes that step as well, with a towel re-use option, efficient water use, and roof plantings that are very pleasant to look out on. The extra charge for Internet service is a bit of a bother, but the fee isn't unreasonable and we've run into this before at better hotels. The only other thing I would change is the Starbucks kiosk in the lobby--they really need to get one that won't frazzle and mess up orders when faced with a large crowd. [But I know that isn't the Hilton's fault!] I am already looking forward to staying at the Hilton for next year's OTAKON.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler09
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat! It's literally half a block from Camden Yards and from the Light Rail station (can take that from the airport). The inner harbor was about 5 blocks, the convention center 2 blocks. The beds were very comfortable, the room was very nice and I didn't hear noise from any of the other rooms. No microwave or fridge, but many places don't have them either. My only minor complaint was service. We had to wait twice to check in (room wasn't ready the first time), and it took literally 45 minutes. I've never wait that long to check into a hotel before. The concierge was never at his desk and we had to wait in line to talk to the front desk who gave us incorrect info. But overall, that wasn't that big of a deal. Skip the Diamond Tavern for breakfast. It wasn't that good, the service was awful and the food was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for Otakon”
Reviews.Author: atthecon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Otakon anime convention. We selected the Hilton because of the connected walkway to the convention center, which was great. Also, many of the convention events took place in the Hilton's conference rooms. Check in was super fast with the kiosk in the lobby. Self parking was $26 a day. Steep, but on par for other hotels in the area. Nice room. Good room service. Nice HD TV with HD programming, but it kept cutting out now and then with the satellite reception. The pool and hot tub and spa were clean and very nice. Room was quiet, clean, and comfortable. Check out on the TV, no problems. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great weekend in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: sistinas138
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Baltimore Hilton for two nights during the giant Anime convention Otakon and could not have asked for anything more convenient as the Hilton connects directly to the huge convention center next door with a nice air conditioned & carpeted skyway which was great for avoiding the summer heat. The convenience alone was worth the price as it mad it so easy to run back to the room and drop off our shopping hauls ☺ The hotel itself is very nice, the lobby is especially lovely. Our room was a bit small (to be expected I guess in the downtown section of a large city) but very comfortable, great beds, nice large desk & well appointed bathroom with Crabtree & Evelyn soaps/shampoo etc. Air conditioner worked great. The view was of the “green” roof garden below which I think is a great idea, much nicer than looking at heating ducts. We had breakfast both mornings at their restaurant the Diamonds Tavern which offers a great buffet, it’s a bit pricey (around $18) but worth it, especially as they have a n awesome chef who will custom make you great omelettes, she can even do “the flip” perfectly and says that since she puts so much love into her cooking it will make you sexy ☺ All of the staff (especially in the restaurant) were very friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. We really enjoyed our stay & have already made reservations to return to this hotel again. Only downside – parking is expensive, as is the internet (no free wifi) but that seems to be the issue with any “better” hotel these days while the cheaper ones offer these services free. (And again, the city location probably accounts for the high parking rates of $24/day)

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay, shame about extra some costs.”
Reviews.Author: dmq24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Baltimore July 26 & 27, 2010 and loved it. We got lucky; we booked online and got this as a top secret hotel - so instead of $249 per night, we paid $99, and it was like we hit the jacpot. 12th floor, with a perfect view of the ballpark. Lovely big king-sized room. Parking in the hotel was just $26 for the two nights. Walking to the Inner Harbopur was just five minutes and had great restaurants. If there is a real downside to the hotel is that there is no free wi-fi, not even in the room or lobby. Its $6.95 for an hour. And breakfast is too expensive: $18 for eggs, and thats in the restaurant and not room service, so yes, a costly breakfast. We will come back here again this year, a great hotel in a great locale, and even if we can't get the same great price on the room, we loved it. Room 1229 was our room with a perfect ballpark view. A word of warning for parents, and its nothing to do with the hotel: the Aquarium is a great day out with the kids, but the admission is insane. $28 for adults, which is coslty, but kids were $25, and that's any aged kids. So if you are a family of four its too expensive for what it has to offer. Your kids will love it, but your wallet won't.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: ojensen
Reviews.Content: Hilton is overrated. They charge you an arm and a leg for everything. Who charges for wi-fi in this day and age!? The hotel itself was nice -- clean, modern. The location was great. But the service and what you get for the money are certainly lacking. We booked a room with a ballpark view and paid extra to get that. When we checked in, we got a room with only partial view. What a dissapointment. The service was also impersonal. We were supposed to get free breakfast with the room, but no one gave us the tickets for it. We had to ask for them afterwards. One of the reasons I booked this hotel was to get a pool and sauna. The pool was on the cold side, the sauna was out of order, and their hot tub had barely luke warm water. The gym was nice -- had a great view of Camden Yards and lots of eqipment. They also have a nice little terrace next to the gym with the park view. Those were probably the best features. But other than that, underwhelming for the money. Next time, we'll stay at a smaller hotel where the service is a bit more personal

Reviews.Title: “What's in a Name?”
Reviews.Author: MJDRN
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton through a discount site online and saved on rate. Alas, this gets you little else. Weather was hot as hell, and my back kept going out so walking wasnt in the plans. NUMBER ONE TIP when going to Baltimore: Parking in this city will soak you. After careful research I discovered that it is MOST ECONOMICAL to park in Long term parking at BWI Airport and take the Light Rail into Baltimore which will drop you you right at Camden Yards or the Convention Center at Pratt St. The City controls all the parking so it is high everywhere. $36 per day versus $14.95 for 2 days (at PreFlight) plus $1.90 fare each way on Light Rail. Do the Math. The Hilton overall is clean, staff is efficient: front desk and bellhops were very kind and accomodating. There was NO early check-in. Being baseball season, the hotel books up and, although we are not Orioles or baseball enthusiasts, it would have been nice to get a room with a better view then overlooking Pratt Street. Camden Yards is beautiful and the history of baseball is right there. We did have a view of the Bromo Seltzer Tower and Maryland Medical Center. We had to check our bags and we went to The Aquarium (make a reservation!) as we got into the city around noon. Aquarium was fascinating but not incredible. If you have to wait for entrance to Aquarium, they send you over to Barnes and Noble or ESPN Zone -- more traps. Having never been to Baltimore, we had to cross-check many of the city maps. Getting around safely is essential and thankfully, Baltimore is very accomodating now with the NEW Circulation Bus which is FREE (stops service at 9pm). And using the water taxi at $10/ day is great for getting back from distant piers aorund the harbor (by 11pm). They come every 10-20 minutes. Don't get sucked into the Inner Harbor tourist trap for food and sites. We ate at the Tra Na Nog Irish restuarant at first but it was a big ticket for nothing special. They couldn't even wow-up Fish and Chips or a basic Reuben sandwhich. Pier 6 near the Marriott is cleaner, safer and close to Little Italy. Alas this was furthest from Hilton. We had lunch at Bertha's in Fell's Point. This was a Rachel Ray recommendation. Yea, the mussels were good, but they should try to clean that place once in awhile -- every area was sticky with grime. Know where you are going in this town: turning any corner and you may get assailed by vagrants. We were fore-warned about the Lexington Market. It may have once been fun, but it is surrounded by bad neighborhoods. We did see the Basillica. Very cool if you like churches. Little Italy is a must for the best food in town. We did Mo's Pasta and Seafood. They actually picked us up and brought us back to the hotel. Nice! Food portions were HUGE. Stuffed Salmon and Shellfish Alfredo. The upstairs dining room kind of smells and the waiters dress in street clothes but food was great. No special amenities at hotel: the beds are snuggly but too soft; the LED TV has a remote "no signal" problem, but if you just channel up, you can fix that. Coffee machine is a joke and turns off before making a full cup of coffee which tastes like the bleached pod paper. Granite counter in bathroom -- big deal. A jacuzzi tub would have been nice, but we got one of the cheap rooms, seemed like a mile walk from the elevator. We were going to try out Diamonds Tavern for dinner one night, but VP Biden was in town -- there was secret service and cops everywhere plus some VIP event in the banquet hall, thus they closed the crosswalk from within the hotel and blocked the street outside the hotel. Couldnt easily access the place. Game attendees had to walk entirely around the hotel to get to the yards. So we went elsewhere. Besides we heard it was pricey and more foo-foo than food. We ended up splurging at Della Notte, a very upscale Tuscan restuarant. IT was costly, but the service and the food was memorable with great portions. Forget about room service at Hilton: you will pay another half the original cost in tip and fees. The gym is well-appointed except for the rinky-dink pool Not everyone does laps, some poeple like to just float or free-style swim. The gym DOES have a great view of Camden Yards. Some other tips/ reminders about Baltimore: they rate high in food inspection statistically. Park at the airport. Study the maps. There is more than the Inner Harbor. The Hilton is a good deal but far from the action unless you love baseball.

Reviews.Title: “Over-all it was great.”
Reviews.Author: Moodyluvah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 4 blocks from the Inner Harbor, which makes for a nice walk. We took taxis quite a bit as my husband has a bad knee and it was very hot during our stay. I asked about a shuttle and was told it wasn't available. The bellman was very friendly and helpful. I was disappointed that parking was $26 a day with valet parking being $36 a day. The room was immaculate there is a great view into the ballpark from the 4 th floor. My husband was disappointed in the pool as it was very narrow and meant for lap-swimming, apparently. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet very much and it had a great variety. Everyone on the staff was very friendly and we were greeted in a nice manner by all we encountered. The only sour note was on check-out. My husband was told we owed money on the breakfast buffet which we had free vouchers for.We were told we had eaten at 2:30 in the afternoon! The desk clerk left while my husband was talking to her with no explanation and she did not come back for 15 minutes. In that time he stood there trying to find out what happened and get help from another clerk. I guess she went on break.....who knows. Our acoount was finally zeroed out by a clerk and then we left. Too bad to end the stay on such a sour note.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the ball field and lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: stacey246
Reviews.Content: This is located in a spot that is perfect if you want to take in a baseball game - either from the park or from your hotel room. With the close proximity to the park, you would think you would hear a lot more from the field in your room. The night we arrived they had fireworks. We could barely hear them in our room. The staff is great and accommodating. They go out of their way from when you walk in the door until you leave. The only complaint I have is about the size of the "pool." I've been to a few lately that are following the same trend - VERY SMALL. This was on the the larger size of small, but still small. Nothing you can really enjoy beyond 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: briggs526
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our friends and four kids from ages 3-10. This hotel was in a great location to the harbor. The rooms were clean and staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs and Runarounds”
Reviews.Author: Radprof
Reviews.Content: I was bitten four times on my forearm by an adult bed bug in the middle of the night of June 20, 2010. I was traveling to Baltimore with my wife and two small children, aged 8 and 2, for outpatient surgery the next day. We stayed in Room 919 and slept in separate beds. Around 3 a.m. I felt the itch, turned on the light, investigated for a mosquito or spider and pulled back the pillow. There on one of them was a very small, almost-round, auburn-colored beetle scurrying fast across the white pillow. I flicked it hard a few times with my fingernail and killed it; my blood dripped across the fabric. I photographed it. We called downstairs and at about 3:45 an “engineer” arrived with insecticide and pliers. He promptly identified it as a bed bug and crushed the carcass with his tool. For the next 45 minutes we were interviewed, made to complete a lengthy security form and moved to another room on another floor (Room 1536). Later that morning, I had shoulder surgery. We could not return to New York until the next day. We grew frustrated by the difficulty of being reasonably compensated for the room, inconvenience, discomfort, clothes cleaning and luggage replacement costs. Websites confirmed that it was a bed bug, and we contacted experts who advised us about the costly risks associated with bringing bugs home. Still Hilton management resisted anything but the idea that this was a) not a bed bug, b) an isolated experience or c) something we had somehow brought with us and carefully planted under the pillow on the far side of the room from our belongings. It became a nightmare ordeal. I had an allergic reaction to the bites that grew swollen and inflamed for several days and required antibiotics. Eventually, our lodging expenses were waived, but Hilton declined to cover our lost luggage and cleaning request, $300. Needless to say, given the traumatic experience, the conduct of Hilton staff and management and the attempted intimidation by Hilton’s insurance company, we won’t be back and would never recommend this hotel to others. P.S. I'll post the stomach-turning photographs at a later date if I can overcome the technical problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: DanJanet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. We stayed in this hotel for 7 days while my husband was in town on a business trip. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is right behind Camden Yards and a 10 minute walk to the harbor. There is even a free bus that stops right in front of the hotel which will take you to the harbor. There is also a train station right behind the hotel which will take you to Washington DC. Since the hotel is right by Camden Yards it is very loud on game nights, but the noise settles down around midnight. I had many questions for the concierge since I was there while my husband worked. I spoke with 2 different people and they were both very helpful and had answers to all of my questions. My only complaint is the lack of a pool. The only pool is an indoor lap pool for exercise, there is no pool for recreation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: suegund
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a really good location. Within a 10 minute walk to the harbor and a great view of the ball park from the fourth floor of the hotel. The conceirge seemed to be unavailable every time they were needed. However, we were fortunate enough to have the assistance of an extremely polite, helpful, knowledgeable bell hop, Greg. He went above and beyond to help us with all our needs and questions and always with a smile. He is an asset to the Hilton and should be commended.

Reviews.Title: “For the money you can do better”
Reviews.Author: dmarie34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in some nice hotels before and expect them to be above average. This hotel just didn't deliver. There pool facilities were not that great; the room was ok, the bed very uncomfortable. Just not what you expect for a nice hotel like the hilton. They even charge you for internet access. I was there on business; I need the internet!! It was $12 per day. yikes. I wouldn't pay the price I did and stay there again. The only bright spot was the service and hotel employees were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great and continues to improve”
Reviews.Author: redfish829
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a number of times on business and recently to see a baseball game. Can't beat the location across from baseball stadium! The staff was efficient and friendly as usual and rooms clean and comfortable. My only negative experience in the past was with the restaurant--service was lax and pretty slow. While breakfast service hasn't really changed, I did notice a change in the dinner service. Even on a busy weekend night, the service was good and the food came out quickly. The manager (Matt) visited our table and really seemed to care that we were satisfied with our meals. Nice to see that level of professionalism and that a good hotel is only getting better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: mcchrystal
Reviews.Content: Clean, well located and a perfect location for us to stay for our daughter's law school graduation. i use a scooter to get around and it was super accessible!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel, Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BuenoBonitoBarrato
Reviews.Content: Beutiful Lobby, Clean Rooms, Spacious Rooms, Clean Bathroom. Got it through Hotwire, same day. Thanks, Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good place to stay near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: RedFoxNewEngland
Reviews.Content: Like a good Hilton. Clean comfortable, and as usual overpriced. Good location next to the convention center - cross the street or use a walkway. Some of the rooms look right down into the Oriols ball park. You can also watch a game from the 4th floor gym, or an adjacent deck. Buffett is good, but smaller than usual. Watch out for the $4 difference between the continental buffet ($14), or the regular buffet (18). They will always charge you $18 even if you get the continental. Some of the staff didn't know that there was a difference in price. The restaurant is actually across the street. Biggest complaint was that they had no complimentary Wall Street Journals, and the gift shop didn't have any for purchase. Parking was expensive, about $36/day, with a steep hourly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Camden Park? This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mad155
Reviews.Content: We came to Baltimore to watch the Indians beat up on the Orioles on Saturday night. The hotel is right beside the ballpark. Sadly our room did not overlook the stadium or the waterfront. But because of my hilton points it was free so i could not really complain. Bed was great, really good water pressure in the shower and the room service saturday night after the game was very efficient and prompt. My burger was hot and the homemade chips are incredible. the hotel is also only about 4 or 5 blocks from the waterfront where there are plenty of resturants and shops. Room was very clean and the bellcap service was outstanding. we were able to check our bag prior to after check out. the bag was never lost, that is not always the case at some hotels. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a very disappointing experience. Poor door staff & poor TV”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravel5
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel there were three staff members door / bell persons, who were engaged in a conversation and failed to assist me with my luggage until I tried to pass to get in the door, and one said, "hey do you need help with that". I almost always use assistance, and tip well, but opted to do it myself, as to not interrupt their obviously important conversation. I have an opportunity to write this on a Saturday night at the hotel. Generally I would be watching a PPV movie because I generally stay in at night, but the sat. TV system does not work well. I have not been able to successfully watch any of the 3 movies I have attempted to watch in the past 2 days. The TV system won't even pull up a guide. Sometimes it just says "no signal" and goes black. I called guest services to ask if anyone else had this issue she said "No, but she would send an engineer up"...When the engineer arrived I told him that I had asked if others were having this problem, he stated that he had several calls regarding this daily. He even called down and said that it wasn't working correctly and to anticipate many more complaints. When I went to get a cab to go to lunch today there were no staff members at the front, so I walked around the building where the cabs for Hilton were lined up, and asked for a ride about 7 blocks, the cab driver refused saying to take the next cab because he was waiting for the hotel door / bell person to call him. I walked back to the front and finally found someone, but opted to walk because of frustration. I ordered dinner from room service. It took over an hour to arrive and was mediocre at best. I called 2x to follow up on the order, and was not offered any compensation for the lengthy wait. The housekeeping service left dirty dishes in my room after service and also did not restock or provide glasses in the bathroom. On the upside, the bed is comfortable, water pressure & temp are okay in the shower

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: luv2teech
Reviews.Content: We went down to watch the Sox play the Orioles for the weekend and found this hotel on a website that discounts the rooms. We arrived about an hour before the game started, on a Friday night and (coming from Boston...) were pleasantly shocked by the ease of getting into the garage and checking in. We would have been stuck in traffic for hours in Boston before or after a game! When we checked in we asked about a room upgrade so we could see Camden Yards from the field. Dennis found us another room for only $20 more a night. FANTASTIC view!!! I strongly recommend asking! Because of the room change, I had to request a change in bed linens as I'm allergic to down. My only complaint (and it's really not huge) is they sent a woman up to change the comforter and pillows immediately (great start!) but it wasn't until morning that I realized she did not swap out all of the pillows---when I woke with swollen, red eyes. It was an annoyance, but not a huge deal. The room was very clean, but I was surprised that a hotel of this caliber did not have a refrigerator in the room. The bed was super comfortable and I've been online trying to buy the same hairdryer! Check out took only a moment. The staff was very knowledgeable and gave great suggestions for places to go and see. We made the huge mistake of skipping brunch on Sunday at the Baseball Tavern to try a local place---don't bother! The Baseball Tavern offers a super breakfast buffet--great variety, hot food and tasty, too! For the same price, better service, and more convenience, we should have stayed right at the hotel! Next time we'll know better. We would ABSOLUTELY return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new and comfortable, but ...”
Reviews.Author: tinkin3
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three days at the Hilton Baltimore. The good: it's clean, the beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are spacious and quiet. This is a fairly new hotel, so you expect that the rooms are going to be good. We were there for a conference, and the hotel did a really great job of accomodating our group - the food was good and everything was done in a timely manner. There is plenty of space for a mid-size group like ours (approx. 250+ people) and I think everyone was satisfied. The bad: It's a bit pricey, but it is Hilton after all.. Even with the "conference rate" I still thought it was a little high. Also, there is NO water in the room, and not even a mini-bar where you can buy a bottle of water. I could not find a vending machine on my floor, so after dinner, i went to the bar and got a huge cup of ice with a little water so I would have something for the night. Also, no free internet. So many Hilton owned properties already offer free internet, but yet the major hotels do not. So disappointing! With that said, overall, it was a good stay and I would stay there again - I think there are a few tweeks that can be made to bring this up to great.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: almona47
Reviews.Content: Went with my wife down to Baltimore to see the Yankees play the Oriole's and stayed here for one night! The location is great, right across the street from Camden Yards. The rooms were large and very comfortable, and the bathroom clean, modern and well equiped. We stayed on the fourth floor, just down the hall from the exercise room and the deck overlooking the ball park. What a great place. The hotel is just a short walk from the Inner Harbour and the Convention Center. The best was I got my room, on a Thursday night, the night of a game, through NYOP and only paid $75, WOW!

Reviews.Title: “"True Hospitality" is the name of this game”
Reviews.Author: homerun60811
Reviews.Content: In April 2010 I attended a conference in this brand new, absolutely gorgeous decor, (1 yr old) Hilton on Pratt Street in Baltimore, MD, directly across from Camden Yards baseball field. I have celiac disease and require gluten and diary free food. Booking through a conference agency, I requested special accommodations which were not communicated to the Hilton. When I ordered breakfast I told the waiter Christopher that I had a food allergy and that I had mentioned it ahead of time. Chris came back and said that the Chef had eggs and fruit for me. Needless to say, I was extremely disappointed, as I travel often and have no other choice but to settle for such a limited menu. I even told Christopher that I could go down the street to Whole Foods and come back with prepared items for breakfast if the chef would allow this. Christopher conveyed my message to the Chef shortly after that Christopher returned and said that the Chef would investigate Whole Foods today and promises that tomorrow I would have some variety to choose from. The Chef introduced himself to me and personally planned the rest of the conventions meals with me, which the staff was well aware of. Much to my surprise, the next morning I had cylindrical cinnamon buns glazed in sugar, brown rice toast and an egg white omelette. It was not only delicious, but also very well presented. In fact, all my meals were healthy, delicious and were well presented. The resident manager introduced himself to me and apologized for the miscommunication as well. He provided me with his card and extended his assistance for the remainder of my stay. He followed through with a number of my meals and made sure that I was completely satisfied and was very visible throughout my stay. I was so pleased with the ease in which my food allergy was handled and with such professionalism. All the waitstaff had been informed and so were the other chefs. I had a consistent and hassle free delivery of my meals throughout the conference. Having had such a carefree business conference, I decided to book a leisure trip at this hotel for a Red Sox Game. This hotel's staff far exceeds any Hilton I have been to. I attend conferences throughout the united states and have been to many, many Hilton's. This one far exceeds the true definition of "hospitality". From the staff to the administrative, this hotel is consistent in its service to the customer. Bravo to Jacque D'Rovencourt, the Resident Manager, the Executive Chef Christian Gallice, and the wait staff Christopher! The rooms are spacious, beautiful and new. The decor has a wonderful ocean and exotic wood overtones with lots of natural materials. The fourth floor gym and pool area are new, clean, easy to use. The full wall of the gym room is glass which overlooks Camden Yards. The adjacent deck is a nice relaxing area to take in a game as well. Easy to get to - a 10 minute ride to the airport. This hotel not only has location, location its priority is the customer and is consistent with the delivery of that goal. A home run in my book! Book today! A real must see.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Stay at the Hilton Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: marian2
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a convention at the Baltimore Convention Center and stayed at the Hilton Baltimore. This hotel is connected to the convention center and is therefore only a short 5 minute walk away. But wait, it gets better! In addition to the convenience, this hotel is just amazing. We reserved a suite on the executive level ( 19th floor) and had a spectacular view over the city. Some rooms look out over Camden Yards ( as does the Executive lounge on the 18th floor) but I loved our view of the Bromo Seltzer clock tower and everything beyond. We had a living room with a pull out sofa and a bedroom with a king bed, one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Mr. Reggie Cox was so accommodating at check in. I needed to get in to my room early because I was a presenter that day and he made it happen. The front desk also allowed us a late check out. The executive lounge was wonderful- the food was fresh, well presented and replaced often. In addition to a continental breakfast, coffee, water, soda and snacks were available all day and from 5-7 they offered a nice variety of hors d'oeuvres, different each evening. Alianna in the executive lounge was wonderful and welcoming. The service at the hotel was impeccable. Everything we asked for was delivered very quickly- wine glasses, an extra robe etc. We were also given a code for free internet access upon check in which was unexpected and greatly appreciated. Staying at the Hilton Baltimore made our experience in Baltimore extra special. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right across the street from Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: BeachDLT-50
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Hilton is a beautiful new hotel directly across the street from Camden Yards and about a half mile from M+T Bank Stadium where the Ravens play. It's about a half mile in the other direction to the harbor. While I was using the gym, if there was a baseball game being played, I could have watched the whole game from the treadmill. They have multiple cardio machines and a rack of bells. My wife used the pool which is about 25 yards and clean. This hotel is in a great location if you're there for a game at either stadium. The front desk staff and bellmen were all very friendly and knowledgeable of the area. The Executive lounge is nicely stocked with very friendly personnel. I'd definitely return when my travel plans bring me to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing comes free”
Reviews.Author: Choco40
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel in great location, right in front of Camden Yard, and waking distance to almost everything in Baltimore. And my stay was to attend conference at Convention Centre, so it was perfect. However, I was surprised by the fact that with the price of the hotel, Internet connection is not free. It costs $12-14 per computer, so if you have a computer and iPhone that you'd wish to connect, you have to pay for 2 connections. $12 connection is a bit slow for standard. I wonder why such thing can't be provided for free. All the other hotels do! And of course breakfast is not included, either. If you don't mind paying $20 or more for breakfast, the staff and the service at the restaurant are great.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms...paper thin walls. Otherwise would've been a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There's a lot of problems with noise in this hotel. The music coming from a bar across the street was heard up on the 10th floor, and my neighbors were extremely loud as well. Walls were paper thin, and I could hear everything. Good hotel if you're up for partying all night. Terrible place if you're trying to get any sleep. Otherwise the staff tried their best to be accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hilton with Super People”
Reviews.Author: TravelsalotMa
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting in the Inner Harbor at another hotel and spent 6 days at the Hilton instead of the hotel where my event was held and I couldn't have been more pleased. My family decided to join me and take advantage of the snow and sites while in town. The hotel in nicely situated and has super access to the harbor area with the free Charm City Circulator bus stop right in front of the hotel. The bellman was super, friendly and amazingly adept at packing a cart with an excessive amount of our luggage. Our room and hospitality suite overlooked Camden Yards with a private balcony, living room, dining room and separate bedroom with 2 bathrooms. To say the least it was the most perfect arrangement for a family of four. The rooms were spotless, kudos to an attentive housekeeping staff. The pool on the 4th floor is lovely and incredibly well maintained by a friendly and hard working Brazilian young lady serving as a lifeguard. She never let a puddle stand, kept the towels fresh and paid attention to the pool goers and children with a smile. She is not directly affiliated with the Hilton I believe but she represented the franchise well. Our kids loved the free breakfast and happy hour munchies in the Executive Lounge daily. I especially found Eric Miller to be a real asset to the team and he handled a difficult patron extremely well. Who would have thought that a lack of hard boiled eggs would send someone over the edge? The views of the ballpark are lovely and the walk or bus ride into the harbor area is manageable. You have direct connection to the convention center so it would be a great stay for events at that location. We also had a few meals at the Diamond Tavern and found something to suit all our needs from full meals to lighter fare. We were especially impressed with the Director of Food and Beverage, Jonathan, who happened upon us on the escalator and inquired if our youngest daughter liked the menu and what she had eaten. He also pointed out the treasure chest of toys for kids dining at the Tavern that we had missed. Overall I was so truly impressed by the genuine concern for our experience and satisfaction. Same thing with Vonjamis in the morning who made a point to check in with us and say good morning, just a great staff and meals. We stay at many Hilton hotels around the world and I must say this is one that I would certainly visit again if only for the lovely accomodations, beautiful pool and hot tub, fitness facility and friendly people. We felt a need to call the Resident Manager while there just to let them know what a great job they are doing. Try it, I don't think you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great view”
Reviews.Author: PickyPic
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at the Hilton. Our room overlooked Camden Yard, what a sight. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The rooms and the hotel were clean and beautiful. We had a great time and will return to the Hilton, hopefully during baseball season.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, courteous staff!”
Reviews.Author: mmd1117
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the executive floor. Front desk staff very helpful with assisting us in making evening plans, getting us a cab, reduced priced tickets for comedy club. Gym and pool area very nice. Had complimentary breakfast at the Diamond Tavern which was quite good. Within walking distance to Inner Harbor. Did however use a cab in the evening due to cold weather/snow.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Kasey99
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I was so surprised that a 4-star hotel/convention center would have such rude staff. I was only staying overnight because was visiting friends for the day. Accidentally, I forgot toothpaste, so I went down to the front desk to see if they had any of the individual sized packets. After asking if they had any, the woman gave me a nasty look, said "uh-huh," and turned around to go into a room behind the desk. When she came back out, she handed me a packet and barely made eye contact with me. I gratefully said "thank you so much," but was so shocked at how rude she was to me. This was not how I wanted to end my night, especially after initially walking into the hotel and being amazed by how beautiful it was. Future guests: please do not forget any of your toiletries, or go to the gift shop before it closes, because it will make your stay at such a great hotel very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating to local attractions (Camden Yards, Raven stadium and inner harbor)”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireTravelers
Reviews.Content: Loved the new hotel....very clean, friendly staff, and the location of the hotel was perfect for our crew. We had a birthday party at Camden Yards which is right across the street. The bar was sleek and fun....closed it at 2:00 AM. Room service was quick and convenient. The gym/pool overlooked the stadium. We used all of the amendities and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “NYE Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: I guess if you stay New Year's Eve in a hotel you don't get a typical night. Had a great rate for the three rooms we booked through Hilton's website. The front desk was very efficient in checking in the large number of people there. We were given three rooms on the 12th floor fairly close to each other and executive lounge passes (I'm a HHonors Gold VIP). The rooms were very nice. If I stayed there again I wouldn't pay more for the Inner Harbor view, the hotel is a few blocks away and there is not much to see. The lounge on the executive floor had a great view of Camden Yards, I may come back for a weekend to see agame some day. One strange thing was the guy with his family who was walking around the executive lounge in bare feet, bathing trunks and t-shirt during breakfast. You would think the staff may have mentioned something. All in all I prefer the Renaissance which is closer to the harbor and has great harbor views from the room.

Reviews.Title: “very nice, rooms, location, service”
Reviews.Author: BrianinMD
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest Hiltons I've stayed at. The service was great from check-in to room service and miscellaneous other employees. The location downtown was superb for the purpose that I needed a room. The rooms were nice, clean and appointed with modern amenities. For the price this is probably one of the better hotels in the downtown/inner harbor area. During baseball season this hotel is about as close to the park as one can get.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: rickoshay1us
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this wonderful hotel. We were looking for a home base to explore both the inner harbor area, and then take some day tours of DC. The staff of this hotel were as friendly and accomodating as any place we have ever stayed. The entire property was spotless. Kudos to the management...We will be back..

Reviews.Title: “great location in the inner harbor”
Reviews.Author: brinicole01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great choice, located near the Inner Harbor. Its right off the highway, we walked out of the hotel and there was the Baltimore Oriole's Stadium. Walking to the Inner Harbor, a few blocks, you pass great restaurants with music and great food. Rooms were nice, staff was friendly.Good deal.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on Baltimore's Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: HI_50
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this hotel as it was the location of a conference I was attending. It was a great experience--quite the expectation for a Hilton. ALL the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nicely updated and clean. We had a great view of Camden Yards. If you get a chance, book a stay when there's a game scheduled. It's like having your own club suite for watching the game. The only downside is that we checked in a bit late and all the rooms on the executive floors were already booked, i.e. we normally upgrade to the executive floors as the concierge lounge is very convenient. There is a great fitness facility. We are swimmers, therefore, made good use of the nice heated lap pool. It can get quite popular and it's not that wide. Since it opened at 5:00 am, we just got up early to do our laps. It's within walking distance to the Inner Harbor where there are numerous great restaurants. And if you need a cab to drive you back they're easy to find and fair-priced. In so far as business goes, I must say that the hotel is quite efficient. Despite the number of us in the hotel, the elevators were always quick and facilities didn't get overcrowded as is quite common when there is a conference on site. Overall a wonderful stay and I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for Orioles Game”
Reviews.Author: Mark509
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for Camden Yards. You literally fall out of bed and there is the stadium. Had a room with a view of the stadium and could see everything that was going on. Rooms are comfortable and staff is friendly. Will stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Home of the Orioles and Ravens!!”
Reviews.Author: Queenymoney
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Baltimore for the opportunity to live out my husband's dream of seeing the Orioles play at Camden Yards. Flying into BWI, we took the train from the airport directly one block from our hotel, the Baltimore Hilton! It was great and much less expensive than taking a cab! The Baltimore Hilton is adjacent to Camden Yards and less than three blocks from the Inner Harbor, where you can eat in lots of restaurants, do some major shopping, even pick up a water taxi to Fort McHenry! If you take the water taxi, get off in the neighborhood of Fell's Point for a pint of Guiness at any of the little taverns! What fun! Fort McHenry should take no more than 1 to 1-1/2 hours to see, then back to the water taxi. There are no restaurants at the Fort, so make sure you eat before you go. As for the Baltimore Hilton - what a great place to stay. Beds were comfortable, rooms were nicely sized, including an easy chair and ottoman, desk and office chair, and an oversized bathroom. Staff were very accommodating, giving us lots of information and maps to help us figure out the train system when we wanted to take a day trip to DC. A day trip to DC is very easy with the great train system - drops you right at Union Station, two blocks from the U.S. Capitol! And then, of course, there were those orange birds, the Orioles! Camden Yards is a great ball field, beautiful in its layout. The Orioles played the Boston Red Sox while we were there and I was amazed at the number of Sox fans had flown in from Boston for the game! It was a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a super hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarleneK
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay at the Hilton Baltimore, and the purpose of my stay was the final two games of the Orioles season. The hotel staff is super, polite, helpful and always smiling. The room was great (I was in an executive room - and facing the ballpark.) Am surprised that they charged for alcohol in the executive lounge. Super convenient to Camden Yards. Comfy bed and amenities. Will definitely return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Baltimore (Exec Floor) - Great!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerforBusiness
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight. Corner Room #2001 great view city/harbor/Camden Yards. All staff encountered were knowledgeable, friendly and very polite. Medium size room but very nicely furnished. No fridge in room. Exec Lounge well placed and acceptable snacks etc. This Lounge charges for alcohol. Exec Breakfast was good. My fav Lavazza coffee. I would stay again and I would recommend particularly for Ravens/Orioles games perfect location walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay if you're going to the ballpark”
Reviews.Author: MARKBUICK76
Reviews.Content: We stayed using our Hilton Points. We stopped here to see a baseball game at Camden Yards. The hotel is right acroos the street and has a balcony on the 4th floor that lets you look into the ballpark, very cool. The hotal is only 2 years old and everything is beautiful. The rooms are gorgeous. Would have preferred queen beds as opposed to doubles, but i'm not picky. The free breakfast we recieved as Hilton Honors gold members was a little dissapointing, as we had to keep asking to refill the buffet with milk, bagels, cups etc. but its free so I can't complain, I will definetly return when seeing a game.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: MaryLouDayton_OH
Reviews.Content: The location was great. Walking distance from the Inner Harbor and Little Italy. Light Rail station less than a block from the hotel. Everyone at the hotel went out of their way to make sure they were available to answer questions, reccommned restaurants and what to do or meet any other need. It has nice bar in the lobby, a wonderful warm and clean pool and workout room! I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful view of the stadium”
Reviews.Author: da_jm
Reviews.Content: we spent two nights at the hilton in september 2009 and while it was nice for a weekend, i can see where it is more geared towards a business traveler with an expense account, as opposed to a family with children. the room we had was very large, with a nice king sized bed and big bathroom and an absolutely stunning view of the baseball stadium. however, there was no refrigerator and no free wi-fi, which were two drawbacks as far as i was concerned. the additional fee for self-parking was a bit high ($26/day) and having to get the ticket validated at the front desk was just an annoyance. it is the perfect location if you're in town for a baseball or football game!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overpriced and underserved”
Reviews.Author: 2manyTradeShows
Reviews.Content: Second stay in 2009 for convention-related business. Loved walking to the convention center. Constantly disappointed at the underperforming staff at Diamond Tavern (breakfast and dinner) ... no napkins on two evenings. Parking garage well lit but poorly marked. Probably will make different reservations for 2010. Hotel room provided avover average sound insulation.

Reviews.Title: “It's not 4 star property”
Reviews.Author: ITaveler
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and leisure. It's not 4 star property. It's new and looks great, but service doesn't match. Front desk personnel forget to provide you with necessary information. Room wasn't very clean when we arrived - I found medication on the floor in the room and hair in the bath tab. Next day we came back to the room to find our towels changed and... that's it. Bathroom wasn't cleaned at all, soap and shampoo - none replaced. I called front desk - it took them around 2 hours to send the maid. In terms of location - it's great for sport funs. It's 5 blocks to the harbor despite the name... Not a lot of dining options around the hotel unless you actually go to the harbor. I wouldn't recommend this hotel - uit is priced as 4 start hotel, but the service is not what you expect from 4 start property.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Cousin_Stevie
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a new property that is going through growing pains, I would venture to guess that some of the construction was a bit shoddy. However the property is gorgeous, and when things go wrong the staff tries to make it right. We stayed in room 2032 from 8/13/09 - 8/16/09, which was small but well appointed. There was some minor damage to the wall near the window and some staining on the bed skirt, all minor. The bed itself was fantastic and I slept well. The TV was as good as I’ve seen at a hotel: HD and lots of it. Hilton amenities are always well done, soaps and hair product from Le Source. There was also a turndown service. The hotel features a superb workout facility overlooking Oriole Park, along with a swimming pool, sauna, and whirlpool spa. The hotel had several issues: 1: The Executive lounge was closed for repairs. As such the hotel comped us with free breakfast at the Diamond Tavern for each day of our trip. I’d say we came out ahead! 2: The Diamond Tavern didn’t have a buffet set up on Friday as promised. We were told that some days, if the occupancy load is low, they won’t set up the buffet. The hotel made it right by allowing us to order as many entrees off the breakfast menu that we wanted. Again, we came out way ahead! 3: Service at the Diamond Tavern was poor. Long waits for food and service. Staff seemed overwhealmed. Matre' d was bussing tables. 4:The whirlpool spa was not operational. 5: The turndown service only came one night (Friday) 6: Maid service showed up at 4:00 on Friday afternoon. 7: Concierge made a reservation at the wrong restaurant. Overall I recommend the Hilton. This will be a 5 start property some day, just not quite yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: sgtrudz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an Orioles game and selected this hotel for the convenience. We have stayed at many Inner Harbor hotels over the years, and this was one of the best. I booked a ballpark view room and was not disappointed - just like sitting in the stadium. The price for the room - considering what other hotels charge - was what I would expect. A few negatives, however, but these did not really impact my rating. First, check in was slow because there was only one person working at the desk at 2:00 p.m. on a Sunday. Second, the restaurant was in a part of the hotel which is across the street. Yes, you can get there through an enclosed walkway, but it didn't feel like part of the hotel. We ate there for breakfast - be prepared for the prices. The breakfast buffet was $19, which I feel is high even for the area. One surprising thing was how quiet this hotel is. At other hotels, you could hear the sirens all night. That didn't happen here. If you want a great hotel convenient to the stadium, this is the place to stay. If you're worried about convenience to the harbor, this one is an easy several block walk, but there are comparables closer to the harbor that I would look at.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to experience the Inner Harbor and Camden”
Reviews.Author: fourseasonsOhio
Reviews.Content: We went to Baltimore to take on the Orioles baseball game and stayed at the Hilton on West Pratt street overlooking Camden. The hotel is very accessible from the freeway but far enough from the freeway to not be disturbed by the site and sounds. We got a room on the 12th floor overlooking Camdem Yard. The view is spectacular and you can see the inner harbor from here. The hotel is well maintained and clean. The self-parking garage underneath the hotel is a great feature since it was clean and safe. Our room was quiet, clean, and well maintained. We were able to walk across the street to Camden, and the nice thing about the location is that the street is closed off during game-day so that it was convenient and safe to go to and from out hotel without dodging traffic. Furtheremore, since it is surrounded by restaurants and the baseball museum, there was a real sense of festivity. We received great personal service from the hotel restaurant for our breakfast. Located on the street level, the hotel restaurant was great place to watch the baseball crowds. A short walk along Pratt street takes you to the inner harbor. I felt safe walking around the area to the Harbor. I would definitely come back to this hotel again the next time my hometown Cleveland Indians play the Orioles. GO TRIBE!

Reviews.Title: “best guest services!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vanaba
Reviews.Content: In town for the red sox game with family & friends, hotel booked full, very busy, couldn't get checked in early, they took our bags to hold until rooms where ready, the young lady at the front desk tried hard to get us a room as it was 10am when we arrived and now almost 3pm, needed 3 rooms, exec floors. had booked one room with ball park view to watch the game from the room on sat nite. Next thing I know, front desk clerk, tells me that she has arranged for an upgrade......Presidental suite. Totally unexpected, being that checkin is at 3pm, I wish I could remember her name, (unusual name)but Im sure she will remember us, she and the front desk manager, gave us the suite so we could all go and freshen up and have room to relax while our other rooms were still being cleaned.The bell man, Dieter was exceptional took great care of us all weekend, Salina, Erik and all the employees in the executive lounge also went above and beyond, The rooms were clean and all staff were very concerned for the care and comfort of all guests. A view of the ball field also from the 4th floor terrace, next to fitness center and pool. I must say that kindness goes a long way on both ends, I realized that they were doing all they could to get us in and I was understanding of this, so maybe my reward was a great upgrade and we cant wait for our visit next year. Stay was well worth the $$$$ paid. Small mishap the fire alarm went off, sat afternoon but after alittle delay things were back to normal. Thanks so much to all at the Baltimore Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Best View Ever”
Reviews.Author: ranpol
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Baltimore was easily the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Very clean I could eat off the floors that's how clean it was. Our room was on the 12th floor and we had a ballpark view room, the best view I ever had, when you open up the curtains Camden yards was right in front of you, the view was great,the room also had a flat screen TV and very quiet you couldn't hear any noise at all, and the hotel is very close to the inner harbor which is also good. Anytime I go to Baltimore this is the hotel I will be staying at, this is clearly the best hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY!!! STAIRS ARE LOCKED!!”
Reviews.Author: bigmof
Reviews.Content: Instead of telling you how depressingly mediocre this hotel was in every way other than the pretty lobby and convenient location, I am going to issue a safety warning of sorts: This hotel locks the staircases. On the last day of the convention I was attending, someone decides to pull the fire alarm. Chaos ensues as everyone rushes to the emergency stairwells only to find that they are locked. You can have no idea how frightening this is until you experience it, so if you're into that then by all means, stay here. But unless you like the idea of being trapped in a burning building, I recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Baltimore is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TXBusinessTraveler
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond member I visit many Hilton properties each year. This is the one of the better properties Hilton offers. It is located right next door to Camden Yards and about six blocks from the Inner Harbor which is an easy walk. The hotel itself is outstanding and seems very new. The front desk staff was quick to check me in (early too - about 2pm) and I was on my way to the room. It was a standard room, but had a nice HD flat screen TV, updated decor and I had a great view of the ballpark. If you ever get a chance to visit here while a game is going on you could grab a 6-pack and watch the entire game from your room. The Inner Harbor is just about six blocks and offers TONS of restaurants and shops and is hoppin' during the summer. Overall this was a great stay and I would definitely return to this property when I come back to Baltimore. Not to mention I got a great rate ($143) since the Orioles weren't in town.

Reviews.Title: “clean and neat”
Reviews.Author: flowman692003
Reviews.Content: this place is great .my wife and i stayed for july 4th fireworks instead of going to the inner harbor to see the fireworks .we stayed at the hotel and saw it all went well . we did the bed and breakfast and it was out of this world . we had a great time rooms were very clean and everything is within walking distance . i plan to say here everytime i travel to the inner harbor . also i slept like a baby thier beds will put youi to sleep

Reviews.Title: “NO AMENITIES!!!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: COPNDOC
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is located near the ballpark and blocks away from the Inner Harbor, but that's ALL! I have nothing positive to say about this horrible hotel! You won't get a king bed even if you BEG for one. The night supervisor informed me that no one staying in a king room was checking out for days....come on!!! I'm not stupid. I was there for six nights and was miserable. The two beds in my room were more like TWIN beds. They were SO SMALL!!!! No internet (unless you want to pay $11.99 PER DAY), no refrigerators in the room (unless you want to pay $25), no microwaves (to heat up leftovers from the fabulous restaurants in the area), and SELF-PARKING is $26 a DAY!!! Go across the street to the Holiday Inn or the Marriott. I assure you the staff will treat you a lot better and the hotel may offer more than just OXYGEN. I will not check any of the amenities below because they are not amenities to me unless they are included in the price I pay for the room. All of the ones listed below are EXTRAS because they come with a price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EricC76
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location for visiting Baltimore. During a trip down the East coast with stops along the way, we stayed for a couple days in Baltimore. We loved everything about the hotel! The best thing is the location. Across the street from Camden Yards and only a few blocks from Inner Harbor, you have easy access to everything. The hotel itself is perfect. We had no complaints about our stay. Check-in was easy, staff was very nice, the room was wonderful, and check-out is simple with their zip check-out. Definitely, definitely get room service or eat at their restaurant for breakfast. We had food delivered to the room for only slightly more than it would have cost to eat at the restaurant, and it was one of the best breakfasts we've ever had! Minor issue was the housekeeping knocking on the door several times starting at 9am the day of checkout, but just as much our fault for not putting out the 'do not disturb' sign. Other than that, we would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: profshanku
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton during a business trip. The hotel is very conveniently located next to the convention center. There is a covered walkway from the second floor. The hotel is about 10 mins walk from Inner Harbor. The hotel has dining tavern in the adjoining building and a bar near the reception. My room had a view of the harbor. Clean and spacious. Excellent housekeeping and room service and very friendly staff. Parking was a little expensive but I guess it is comparable to the rates in the Inner Harbor area. Great hotel, especially if you are in town for a conference at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “The beds are horrible, but almost everything else is divine!”
Reviews.Author: DodgerOfZion
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, this is the highest starred hotel I've had the privilege of staying in, ever, in the history of my life. My mother invited me to tag along on her conference in Baltimore, and of course I accepted when she told me we'd be staying in the Hilton. The first thing I noticed when I walked into the lobby was the sheer size of the lobby, as well as the ginormous bar that had on all the local sports. First, I'll get the bad stuff out of the way. I'm a Choice Hotel person myself, and at all but one I've stayed at, the computer use was FREE to all guests (the lone exception had no computer center)...the one that also had printers allowed you to print in black and white for FREE, too! Not at the Hilton, though. It's $60/hour even if you just want to play solitaire, and if you want to print something out, that's $1 for a B&W page, and $2 for color. Dubya tee eff! I figured it would be the OTHER way around, but then again, people who stay at the Hilton tend to have quite a bit of money. Another problem was the bed. You'd think at a 3+ star hotel, the beds would be the epitome of comfort, right? Not here! The beds were the most uncomfortable things I have ever slept in. I almost slept on the recliner that was in our room. Another issue is the RIDICULOUS prices! $4 for a TWELVE OUNCE COKE!? The Diamond Tavern is the restaurant across the street from the main hotel, and is part of the Baltimore Hilton, but AVOID IT for EVERYTHING but dessert and the cocktails. The beef sandwich I ordered tasted like straight-up salt, but the white chocolate cheesecake (which was FREE!) was DIVINE. Everything else was EXCELLENT. When my mother seemed to have misplaced every form of ID she had (it was in the back seat of my car the whole time, which I didn't discover until I had gotten home), the clerk at the check-in counter allowed her to check in with her AHA CPR card, informing her "We won't be responsible for fraudulent charges." Once her driver's license had been faxed into the hotel from the office back in Jersey, all was well in the world. The room service is wonderful, coming quickly, and although it's danged expensive, the food was quite delicious. The menu is the same as the restaurant I mentioned, but it's prepared with much greater care. Every room has an HDTV with 100 channels. The Harbor is a couple of blocks away and all the things that go with it. DC is also a short drive and METRO ride away. If you're not from the immediate 500 mile area, Philadelphia and the Jersey Shore are 2 hours or so away. When I was leaving (my mother was staying for her work, and would be coming home with a co-worker), my mother asked me if I had enough decadence for one lifetime. Not even close, I didn't get to try the Godiva chocolate chip pancakes! Yes, you read that right. Other than not being able to get on the internet and having to sleep in god-awful beds, I really enjoyed my stay here. If you've got the cash to splurge and you're going to be in Raventown, give this ritzy place a looksie.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: cassiopiea
Reviews.Content: Typical business type of hotel stay. Usual hotel amenities. Nothing surprising. Only negative experience I had was when they were cleaning the floors in the hallway, you can smell the chemicals in the air - and you can't open any windows at this hotel. Not as fancy as the Hyatt, but it was a decent stay - espeically for those who are baseball fans, which I could care less about.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: DACHNA
Reviews.Content: You will absolutely love this hotel, esp if you are a basball fan. Hotel offers a great view of Camden yards from a nice terrace as well as from the gym and pool areas. It was such a thrill to just watch the ground crew cleaning up the field from the terrace of the hotel. Nice View!! The hotel was absolutely spotless. The room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The pool was immaculate as well as the jaccuzzi (and im not one that says that so easily). The staff was was extremely friendly and at your service. The only thing I would complain about is the price of the food. I mean it was like $20 for fruit and a crossant..little pricey for me. However, there is a restaurant about a block away where you can get breakfast for half the price!! however, you are on vacation and some people are willing to pay that price. Overall i thought it was a great experience and i will definetly be returning next basball season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotl”
Reviews.Author: senor_boom
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location in downtown Baltimore. Easy to get in and out of the city and close to several good downtown neighboorhoods. Its within walking distance to the Inner Harbor, if you're into that kind of thing. (Do yourself a favor and go explore Federal Hill or Canton or Mt Vernon and get a better taste of Baltimore). The carpet colors are definetely interesting, but I guess it works. Lobby is very spartan and modern. Fitness center and pool are good for exercise. Overall, a very nice convention/business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fine.”
Reviews.Author: divera67
Reviews.Content: clean, staff helpful. average location, a bit pricey for food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect night with the O's”
Reviews.Author: amloveam
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! Perfect for a weekend trip to Inner Harbor and to catch an O's game. So convenient to Camden Yards- Only down side, if you go on a weekend, be prepared for some pretty loud top 20 bar music to be playing until the wee hours of the night. Didn't bother my husband and I but if you have small children this may be a problem

Reviews.Title: “Very nice new hotel in downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Docsam
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers stated, great for baseball fans! About 20% of the rooms have a fantastic view on the ballpark and can see every play better than anyone else sitting in the stadium itself. If in a room without a view, there is a terrace in the excellently appointed gym and pool where folks can stand and watch. I watched nearly the whole Orioles game will on the treadmill with the game on TV for audio and the live event in front of me. By the end of it, I had run about 7 miles and did not even feel it! And the Orioles won! Otherwise, good hotel location for the convention center (connects directly) but about 15mns walk from the Inner Harbor. Surrounding area was safe even late at night but you could see that a bit further it may get scary. Only suggestion would be to expend the gym hours beyond 10 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Wowee! Perfect for baseball fans.”
Reviews.Author: marybcole
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my family, including my 13 year-old son. We were in town for Orioles home opener against the Yankees, followed by two more games during the Easter holiday week. Walk to the stadium is 60 seconds! Our room faced the ball field, and from the 9th floor, we could see about 1/3 of the field. Rooms that are higher or closer to the elevator likely peek into the stadium a bit more, but it was plenty for us. Very exciting to watch the goings on from your room. Staff was perfect and even ran to the restaurant next door to get me a few sodas when the machine on my floor ate the money! We travelled with another family (kids ages 6, 11, 13) and we all enjoyed the hotel. We used the 4th floor pool and hot tub once or twice per day. While the pool is technically a lap pool, it's plenty big for families and we saw no one attempting to swim laps. The pool and exercise area have a great view of the ball field. Recommendations: NEED WATER in the vending machines! I switched to the Hilton from the Hampton Inn Camden Yards when I saw an attractive spring saver package on the hotel's web site. Both hotels are in the hilton family, so the person who made my reservation at the Hilton was able to cancel the other in the same call. I did have to ASK for the spring saver package when I called. Both are nice hotels, but the Hilton is much roomier and more luxurious. My son was elated that his favorite restaurant (Subway) was right across the street. Other meals included Jimmy's Diner, Miss Shirley's, Peace and a Cup of Joe and a Bagel shop on Light Street for breakfast. Dinner at the Glass Grill (a 10 minute car ride) and of course BBQ at Camden Yards. Highly recommend the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: H00fhearted
Reviews.Content: Baltimore's slogan is "two feet from anywhere", and it's true! I spent 4 days in Baltimore for a convention (with time built in for sightseeing) and saw a ton of stuff with no car. The light rail (blue line) is $1.60 each way from the airport and drops off directly on the side of the hotel. It's about a half block walk to the front desk. The hotel itself is about 6 months old and (obviously) in great condition. The staff is well trained and very helpful. Ate in the hotel restaurant (Diamond Tavern) for dinner and would also recommend that for eats and drinks. The hotel is directly across the street from Camden Yards, and the rooms on one side of the hotel look down into the stadium. I will be returning to this hotel when baseball season starts!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: asander74
Reviews.Content: I love hotlels near stadiums.I just like having a view of the sports venue from my room. This is a quality hotel. The service was great, the foos was good and the location was the best. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “So new and clean!”
Reviews.Author: sse1078
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I was there for one night for business and enjoyed my stay tremendously. When I got there, I was impressed by the huge lobby and what seemed to be a happening bar scene. Room -very spacious - as large of a single room that I've had.
