It was clean and quiet and the bed was comfortable. -desk had easy access to electric plugs on lamp for computer; desk was very spacious -wireless access was about $12/day and worked well -closet was very small but plenty for my one night stay -flat screen tv with lots of channels including cnn, cnbc, and hbo -my view was of Orioles stadium - fabulous, I could've watched the game if there was one Bathroom -granite countertop -standard bathtub -my only complaint was that the water pressure wasn't very strong and the hot water was not hot enough! -crabtree and evelyn bathroom products Food - Room Service -Lavazza coffee maker -2 .5L bottles of water -I didn't see a mini-bar but I didn't look closely -At night I ordered a crab cake and it was very tasty - very little filler -In the morning I ordered poached eggs and toast with ham, juice and cofffee -- was $18 Fitness Center -Probably the biggest fitness center I've been in that was not a public gym - All Precor -10 treadmills -7 Ellipticals -Weight machines and free weights -lap pool that looked like 2 people could use simultaneously

Reviews.Title: “Very good convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: Accounting Professor
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hilton during my spouse's scientific meeting at the Baltimore Convention Center. The hotel was fully booked, but I never experienced that "overly crowded" feeling. There was never a long wait for the elevator or excessive crowds in the lobby. A second floor sky walk connects directly to the convention center, which is very convenient on a dreary March day and reduces foot traffic in the lobby. Our room overlooked Camden Yard stadium. Great view for my spouse, a baseball freak! The desk was comfortable for working on our laptop. The 41" LCD HD TV was great. Plenty of cable channels. I only wish I had brought my USB plug to connect my portable DVD player. The bathroom was well laid out, but don't expect Four Season size. I noted issues with hot water in another review. I am a bath person and I quickly learned that one must let the water run for a minute or so before it is hot. My husband had no problems with the shower. We had drinks one evening at the lobby bar. Service was efficient. The pour was generous. Baltimore has many good restaurants. For that reason, we never tried the hotel restaurant. I can advise that a good, casual restaurant, Frank and Nic's West End Grille, is directly across the street. The fitness center is large and well equipped with treadmills, elipticals, weights, yoga and Pilates mats, balance board, etc. You overlook Camden Yard if you are on the front row of equipment. The attendant did an excellent job of keeping the room clean. The pool room is adjacent to the exercise room and very light and airy. There are plenty of windows and lots of comfy chaises and chairs. The same attendant also did an excellent job of keeping the pool area clean. This Hilton is a great convention hotel. The location is outstanding. It is only a $7 cab ride to the trendy restaurants and clubs in the East Harbor district. We were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Pubic hair lukewarm shower in bathroom! Ewww!”
Reviews.Author: dessi_9
Reviews.Content: Sweet receptionist. Nice concierge, not very knowledgeable of the area. Nice breakfast - $50 for two omlettes and two juices. Dirty bathroom. Dust and pubic hair in several different spots around the bathroom and the bathtub. Lukewarm water in shower. Called reception, they promised to send someone to fix the shower and clean the rooms. On the afternoon on the next day water was hot, but bathroom still dirty with pubic hair remaining in several different spots. Nice pool with very attentive lifeguard. Chambermaids noisily kept slamming doors all morning making it hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “been to better hiltons”
Reviews.Author: cal_trip_2007
Reviews.Content: stayed at hilton during a business trip two things that I thought were a rip-off -$9.95 internet fee(this should be complimentary!) -$26-$36 parking fee(this should be nominal!) If I knew ahead of time, I would have taken the $12 shuttle from BWI or just taken the MTA which is stops right next to hilton! The rooms were pretty much the standard hilton rooms. The reception and concierge was extremely helpful The food at diamond tavern was ok. not a lot of vegetarian options that bothered a colleague of mine. The meat dishes were not up to par with what I expect for the price. house keeping did a great job, no complains there.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Luv2DrivePA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is obviously new - so it's still clean and smells pretty good - it's also a totally smoke free facility, which is REALLY nice. The view of Camden Yards is amazing. The weather was beautiful so I could see Oriole Park (I could even see homeplate from my 17th floor room) and quite far into the skyline. The housekeeping staff was particularly friendly. there were however, a few things that could have been better. As a business traveler, and Hilton Honors member, I get used to the "little" things that make a stay so enjoyable - like free internet (9.95/24hours) - and slightly larger rooms (there are 757, so they really crammed 'em in) - and front desk staff that doesn't continually pass you from one extension to another. The first day wake-up call was also at the wrong time (I know this happens from time to time, but added to everything else, it didn't help). For the price I paid (296/night) I expected more. In all, it was a nice hotel, but next time, I will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: missykayePA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new and clean and the beds were very comfortable. Our only problem was that we booked a "sight and sound" room, which is supposed to have free internet, and were not placed in that type of room. As a result, it was a challenge to get free internet. We had to pay for it and then argue with the staff about why we were supposed to receive free internet. Eventually, however, they did refund the internet charges. So, if you are booking a sight and sound room to get free internet, make sure that you are actually placed in that type of room. The hotel is connected to the convention center, which was very convenient. It's also about a 5-10 minute walk to the Inner Harbor area, where there are shops, restaurants, the National Aquarium, etc. Although the area between the hotel and Inner Harbor is well lit and bustling, be warned that day and night we were approached at nearly every block by homeless people asking for money. We did not have this problem, however, in the area immediately surrounding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But would definately stay somewhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: RU98Grad
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel. I booked my room at this hotel because I was coming in for a conference and wanted to be near the convention center. I'm also a baseball fan so I wanted the "view" of the Ballpark. I stayed 5 nights at a rate of $235 per night for the Executive Floor (plus about $40 PN in fees). Don't know what anyone would do without being on the "Executive Floor." There aren't refrigerators in any of the rooms, so if you want cold water, you have to go the "lounge" - which is located on the 18th floor. The lounge is open from 6:30 am - to 11:00pm. The breakfast is available until 11:00am, and then the "appitizers" are served from 5:00 - 7:00. in between those hours, you can still access the lounge for cold beverages and cookies. With no refrigerator in the room, worth every penny! It took me 3 days to find my way from the hotel (including what floor to be on), and the convention center. There are NO DIRECTIONS! we were completely lost. There should be something in the elevators that says "USE L2 for CONVENTION CENTER SKYWALK." Staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby bar was packed every night. Didn't try out the in-house restaurant. No sense in taking (or paying more) for a "ballpark" view if you arent on the Executive floors, you can't see in the stadium, all that is in front of you is a steel structure. I was on the 20th floor - (top) and could barely see in. Now, why I would not be back to this hotel. TOO FAR TO WALK!!! OK if you are only going for a day or 2, you wouldn't mind the walk to the Harbor, but 5 days. Never again. First of all, I was bored after 2 days - Went on 2 Stadium tours, Toured the USS Constitution, a submarine, Science Center, Aquarium, even walked 8 blocks in the opposite direction to B&O Railroad museum (that was awesome). We had a car so we drove to "Bo Brooks" - used the GPS and still got lost - evidently they built condos around the restaurant, so you have to know where it is! After finally calling them to ask how to get there, the crab cakes were some of the best I have ever eaten. Don't waste your time at Phillips for dinner - too touristy and the CC aren't very good. Though, it was a great place to hang outside and have a drink in the afternoon. Also ate at Fogo de Chao (excellent, but the cuts of beef aren't as good as a good steak house), Cheesecake Factory (Had a 2-hr wait on a Tuesday night), DSX (sports bar on Pratt just across the street from the hotel), DaMimmo's (OMG! - AWESOME! free limo pick-up / drop off service to any of the local hotels) in Little Italy (VERY expensive, though), Shula's Steak House (food was fabulous, but the service was lacking), ESPN Zone (had to watch the Playoffs somewhere!), Hard Rock, and the Capital Grille. If I do go back, which won't be for years, I would definately stay at a more "central" location, like the Hyatt Regency, or the Renaissance Hotel, which are actually the same distance to the Convention Center, and you won't have to walk a mile at night.

Reviews.Title: “New!”
Reviews.Author: Nature_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Hilton is new and sparkling clean. The room was comfortable and I enjoyed the terrific sunsets from eight floors up and a cool view of the Oriole's stadium at Camden Yards. I couldn't reach the shower head to adjust the flow, and the housekeepers never replaced the "to go" cups after the first night. Neither did they replace the coffee for the coffee maker. Yikes. That was hard to deal with when I've become accustomed to having a nice cup of Joe in my room and then taking one with me as I set out for the day. I even called the front desk for more coffee the night before, and they failed to bring it. The concierge was helpful and made great restaurant suggestions. They did mis-schedule the Super Shuttle for me though. That meant I got a wake-up call at 3:45 am saying the Shuttle was waiting for me...the day before I left. Their $19 breakfast buffet was pretty plain. They brought me a coffee carafe but cleared my table when I went to grab another muffin. There went my precious coffee. What's the deal with me and my Hilton coffee? Then the waitress never brought me any more though she knew the busboy had cleared my table. :( I gave their restaurant another try for dinner. The service was slow but courteous. The caesar salad was so salty I'm still retaining water. The sliders were overcooked. I think the restaurant needs some help to reach the level of service I expect from such an expensive place. All in all, I'll stay somewhere else next time I'm in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “$112 per night - Previous Review Revised”
Reviews.Author: Stoopmensch
Reviews.Content: Now that I spent a night here, I withdraw my previous complaint about this brand-new hotel's parking policy, which their website says allows no in/out parking. As a guest, I was allowed to take my car out to attend a wedding without having to pay the $26 per night garage fee twice. The hotel itself is in a perfect location. It sits directly across the street from the Orioles Camden Yards stadium (one of the few big league parks that hasn't sold its name to a defunct telephone company or a bankrupt bank). It's quite a dramatic site to see when walking out of the lobby. On the other side of the hotel, you get a nice view of the Bromo Seltzer tower (although the city fathers have long since removed the giant Bromo bottle from the top, leaving just a turret). You also see the Marriott all lit up, except the "M" in the name is burnt out. The standard room is quite spacious and gives you the option of wireless or DSL internet access. It's tastefully furnished and well-lit. I have a quibble about the lack of bottled water or a mini-bar in the room. Many hotels automatically stock rooms with water and charge if your drink. Here you have to order from room service and pay not just the expected $3 price but a $4 delivery fee. But no real complaints, considering I paid $112 for a room listed as $209. Use Priceline. Also, this hotel was financed with city bonds, so they are required to set aside the majority of the rooms for convention business. So, I assume, if you are there when no convention is scheduled, they have lots of rooms they want to unload. Sitting on Pratt Street, the hotel is a 5-minute drive to Mt. Vernon and an easy shot to anything else you want to see in town. It's also close enough to the University of Maryland grad campus so that you can find a decent, unpretentious & cheap coffee shop, Peace & a Cup of Joe, at 713 W. Pratt St. Some basic wholesome food (sandwiches made to order) and organic fair trade coffee. Some nights there is live poetry, jazz or rock and there is an art vending machine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the new Balitmore Hilton”
Reviews.Author: NolaHal
Reviews.Content: I was in Balitmore for a meeting and booked a room here because of their "grand opening" rates. It was, I fear, a very special time and place. The Baltimore Hilton is a large, new full-service hotel, built hard against the Camden Yards and the convention center. The staff was helpful, professional and friendly. My room was large, perfectly designed for a business traveler, and lacked "punch list" problems. I was its first guest. Room service came promptly. The food was good and reasonably priced. The fitness center had plenty of aerobics machines. My room had an excellent view of the outfield; I could see home plate from the fitness room. The true test of this place is whether the staff, rooms, and public areas will still sparkle after a year of ball games and conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Beginning”
Reviews.Author: HopesandDreams
Reviews.Content: New hotel just opened last week. They were still experiencing some of the glitches involved in opening a new hotel, hence the 4 rating instead of 5 but overall a good experience. A few nice touches: 1) Some of the rooms overlook Camden Park. You can actually see the interior of the Stadium from your room and with binoculars you might be able to watch the game. 2) The interior of the rooms have a new style desk with a "sub" computer desk underneath, to allow easier use of your laptop. I also enjoyed the interior room furnishing which were comfy. 3) The new flat screen TVs offer a wonderful selection of entertainment - more than movies and the usual TV selections. 4) The fitness center is wonderful for on the road fitness. 10 Treadmills, 7 Ellipticals, 3 Bikes, weights and 7 or 8 other pieces of equipment - all to be used while overlooking an enviable great view right into Camden Park and home plate! The center also includes a full sauna, full swimming pool and jacuzzi and an outdoor patio (which also overlooks Camden Park). Tip: Make sure you bring your earplugs to plug into the entertainment center equipment. The staff clearly is well trained and they are working hard to show it! It is a new downtown hotel so expect to pay for parking and the newness of the hotel and it's amenities - but a good start for a convention hotel.
